command.name: version
command.description: The command allows the Host to specify the desired EZSP version and must be sent before any other command. This document describes EZSP version 4 and stack type 2 (mesh). The response provides information about the firmware running on the NCP.

parameter.name: desiredProtocolVersion
parameter.description: The EZSP version the Host wishes to use. To successfully set the version and allow other commands.

parameter.name: protocolVersion
parameter.description: The EZSP version the NCP is using

parameter.name: stackType
parameter.description: The type of stack running on the NCP

parameter.name: stackVersion
parameter.description: The version number of the stack

command.name: getLibraryStatus
command.description: This retrieves the status of the passed library ID to determine if it is compiled into the stack.

parameter.name: libraryId
parameter.description: The ID of the library being queried.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The status of the library being queried.

command.name: setConcentrator
command.description: Enable/disable concentrator support.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: If this bool is true the concentrator support is enabled. Otherwise is disabled. If this bool is false all the other arguments are ignored.

parameter.name: concentratorType
parameter.description: Must be either EMBER_HIGH_RAM_CONCENTRATOR or EMBER_LOW_RAM_CONCENTRATOR. The former is used when the caller has enough memory to store source routes for the whole network. In that case, remote nodes stop sending route records once the concentrator has successfully received one. The latter is used when the concentrator has insufficient RAM to store all outbound source routes. In that case, route records are sent to the concentrator prior to every inbound APS unicast.

parameter.name: minTime
parameter.description: The minimum amount of time that must pass between MTORR broadcasts.

parameter.name: maxTime
parameter.description: The maximum amount of time that can pass between MTORR broadcasts.

parameter.name: routeErrorThreshold
parameter.description: The number of route errors that will trigger a re-broadcast of the MTORR.

parameter.name: deliveryFailureThreshold
parameter.description: The number of APS delivery failures that will trigger a re-broadcast of the MTORR.

parameter.name: maxHops
parameter.description: The maximum number of hops that the MTORR broadcast will be allowed to have. A value of 0 will be converted to the EMBER_MAX_HOPS value set by the stack.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: launchStandaloneBootloader
command.description: Quits the current application and launches the standalone bootloader (if installed) The function returns an error if the standalone bootloader is not present

parameter.name: mode
parameter.description: Controls the mode in which the standalone bootloader will run. See the app. note for full details. Options are: STANDALONE_BOOTLOADER_NORMAL_MODE: Will listen for an over-the-air image transfer on the current channel with current power settings. STANDALONE_BOOTLOADER_RECOVERY_MODE: Will listen for an over-the-air im-age transfer on the default channel with default power settings. Both modes also allow an image transfer to begin with XMODEM over the serial protocol's Bootloader Frame.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: getStandaloneBootloaderVersionPlatMicroPhy
command.description: Detects if the standalone bootloader is installed, and if so returns the installed version. If not return 0xffff. A returned version of 0x1234 would indicate version 1.2 build 34. Also return the node's version of PLAT, MICRO and PHY.

parameter.name: bootloaderVersion
parameter.description: BOOTLOADER_INVALID_VERSION if the standalone bootloader is not present, or the version of the installed standalone bootloader.

parameter.name: nodePlat
parameter.description: The value of PLAT on the node.

parameter.name: nodeMicro
parameter.description: The value of MICRO on the node.

parameter.name: nodePhy
parameter.description: The value of PHY on the node.

command.name: getConfigurationValue
command.description: Reads a configuration value from the NCP

parameter.name: configId
parameter.description: Identifies which configuration value to read

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the value was read successfully, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize configId.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The configuration value.

command.name: setConfigurationValue
command.description: Writes a configuration value to the NCP. Configuration values can be modified by the Host after the NCP has reset. Once the status of the stack changes to EMBER_NETWORK_UP, configuration values can no longer be modified and this command will respond with EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_CALL.

parameter.name: configId
parameter.description: Identifies which configuration value to change.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The new configuration value.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the configuration value was changed, EZSP_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY if the new value exceeded the available memory, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE if the new value was out of bounds, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize configId, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_CALL if configuration values can no longer be modified.

command.name: addEndpoint
command.description: Configures endpoint information on the NCP. The NCP does not remember these settings after a reset. Endpoints can be added by the Host after the NCP has reset. Once the status of the stack changes to EMBER_NETWORK_UP, endpoints can no longer be added and this command will respond with EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_CALL.

parameter.name: endpoint
parameter.description: The application endpoint to be added.

parameter.name: profileId
parameter.description: The endpoint's application profile.

parameter.name: deviceId
parameter.description: The endpoint's device ID within the application profile.

parameter.name: appFlags
parameter.description: The device version and flags indicating description availability.

parameter.name: inputClusterCount
parameter.description: The number of cluster IDs in inputClusterList.

parameter.name: outputClusterCount
parameter.description: The number of cluster IDs in outputClusterList

parameter.name: inputClusterList
parameter.description: Input cluster IDs the endpoint will accept.

parameter.name: outputClusterList
parameter.description: Output cluster IDs the endpoint may send.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the configuration value was changed, EZSP_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY if the new value exceeded the available memory, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE if the new value was out of bounds, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize configId, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_CALL if configuration values can no longer be modified.

command.name: setPolicy
command.description: Allows the Host to change the policies used by the NCP to make fast decisions.

parameter.name: policyId
parameter.description: Identifies which policy to modify.

parameter.name: decisionId
parameter.description: The new decision for the specified policy.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the policy was changed, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize policyId.

command.name: getPolicy
command.description: Allows the Host to read the policies used by the NCP to make fast decisions.

parameter.name: policyId
parameter.description: Identifies which policy to modify.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the policy was changed, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize policyId.

parameter.name: decisionId
parameter.description: The current decision for the specified policy.

command.name: getValue
command.description: Reads a value from the NCP.

parameter.name: valueId
parameter.description: Identifies which policy to modify.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the value was read successfully, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize valueId.

parameter.name: valueLength
parameter.description: The length of the value parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The value.

command.name: setValue
command.description: Writes a value to the NCP.

parameter.name: valueId
parameter.description: Identifies which policy to change.

parameter.name: valueLength
parameter.description: The length of the value parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The new value.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EZSP_SUCCESS if the value was changed, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE if the new value was out of bounds, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID if the NCP does not recognize valueId, EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_CALL if the value could not be modified.

command.name: invalidCommand
command.description: Indicates that the NCP received an invalid command.

parameter.name: reason
parameter.description: The reason why the command was invalid.

command.name: callback
command.description: Allows the NCP to respond with a pending callback.

command.name: noCallbacks
command.description: Indicates that there are currently no pending callbacks.

command.name: readAndClearCounters
command.description: Retrieves and clears Ember counters. See the EmberCounterType enumeration for the counter types.

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: A list of all counter values ordered according to the EmberCounterType enumeration.

command.name: readCounters
command.description: Retrieves Ember counters. See the EmberCounterType enumeration for the counter types.

parameter.name: values
parameter.description: A list of all counter values ordered according to the EmberCounterType enumeration.

command.name: getMfgToken
command.description: Retrieves a manufacturing token from the Flash Information Area of the NCP (except for EZSP_STACK_CAL_DATA which is managed by the stack).

parameter.name: tokenId
parameter.description: Which manufacturing token to read.

parameter.name: tokenDataLength
parameter.description: The length of the tokenData parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: tokenData
parameter.description: The manufacturing token data.

command.name: stackTokenChangedHandler
command.description: A callback invoked to inform the application that a stack token has changed.

parameter.name: tokenAddress
parameter.description: The address of the stack token that has changed.

command.name: incomingSenderEui64Handler
command.description: A callback indicating a message has been received containing the EUI64 of the sender. This callback is called immediately before the incomingMessageHandler callback. It is not called if the incoming message did not contain the EUI64 of the sender.

parameter.name: senderEui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the sender.

command.name: changeSourceRouteHandler
command.description: Change the source route entry in a source route table.

parameter.name: newChildId
parameter.description: The source/neighbor for which the source route entry is changed.

parameter.name: newParentId
parameter.description: The parent of the source/neighbor for which the source route entry is changed.

parameter.name: ourChild
parameter.description: Is the source our child?

command.name: incomingManyToOneRouteRequestHandler
command.description: A callback indicating that a many-to-one route to the concentrator with the given short and long id is available for use.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: The short id of the concentrator.

parameter.name: longId
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the concentrator.

parameter.name: cost
parameter.description: The path cost to the concentrator. The cost may decrease as additional route request packets for this discovery arrive, but the callback is made only once.

command.name: counterRolloverHandler
command.description: This call is fired when a counter exceeds its threshold.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Type of Counter.

command.name: getXncpInfo
command.description: Allows the HOST to know whether the NCP is running the XNCP library. If so, the response contains also the manufacturer ID and the version number of the XNCP application that is running on the NCP.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS if the NCP is running the XNCP library. EMBER_INVALID_CALL otherwise.

parameter.name: manufacturerId
parameter.description: The manufactured ID the user has defined in the XNCP application.

parameter.name: versionNumber
parameter.description: The version number of the XNCP application.

command.name: getEui64
command.description: Returns the EUI64 ID of the local node.

parameter.name: eui64
parameter.description: The 64-bit ID.

command.name: getNodeId
command.description: Returns the 16-bit node ID of the local node.

parameter.name: nodeId
parameter.description: The 16-bit ID.

command.name: networkInit
command.description: Resume network operation after a reboot. The node retains its original type. This should be called on startup whether or not the node was previously part of a network. EMBER_NOT_JOINED is returned if the node is not part of a network.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value that indicates one of the following: successful initialization, EMBER_NOT_JOINED if the node is not part of a network, or the reason for failure.

command.name: stackStatusHandler
command.description: A callback invoked when the status of the stack changes. If the status parameter equals EMBER_NETWORK_UP, then the getNetworkParameters command can be called to obtain the new network parameters. If any of the parameters are being stored in nonvolatile memory by the Host, the stored values should be updated.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Stack status. One of the following: EMBER_NETWORK_UP, EMBER_NETWORK_DOWN, EMBER_JOIN_FAILED, EMBER_MOVE_FAILED

command.name: startScan
command.description: This function will start a scan.

parameter.name: scanType
parameter.description: Indicates the type of scan to be performed. Possible values are: EZSP_ENERGY_SCAN and EZSP_ACTIVE_SCAN. For each type, the respective callback for reporting results is: energyScanResultHandler and networkFoundHandler. The energy scan and active scan report errors and completion via the scanCompleteHandler

parameter.name: channelMask
parameter.description: Bits set as 1 indicate that this particular channel should be scanned. Bits set to 0 indicate that this particular channel should not be scanned. For example, a channelMask value of 0x00000001 would indicate that only channel 0 should be scanned. Valid channels range from 11 to 26 inclusive. This translates to a channel mask value of 0x07FFF800. As a convenience, a value of 0 is reinterpreted as the mask for the current channel.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.description: Sets the exponent of the number of scan periods, where a scan period is 960 symbols. The scan will occur for ((2^duration) + 1) scan periods.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS signals that the scan successfully started. Possible error responses and their meanings: EMBER_MAC_SCANNING, we are already scanning; EMBER_MAC_JOINED_NETWORK, we are currently joined to a network and cannot begin a scan; EMBER_MAC_BAD_SCAN_DURATION, we have set a duration value that is not 0..14 inclusive; EMBER_MAC_INCORRECT_SCAN_TYPE, we have requested an undefined scanning type; EMBER_MAC_INVALID_CHANNEL_MASK, our channel mask did not specify any valid channels.

command.name: energyScanRequest
command.description: Sends a ZDO energy scan request. This request may only be sent by the current network manager and must be unicast, not broadcast. See ezsp-utils.h for related macros emberSetNetworkManagerRequest() and emberChangeChannelRequest()

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The network address of the node to perform the scan.

parameter.name: scanChannels
parameter.description: A mask of the channels to be scanned.

parameter.name: scanDuration
parameter.description: How long to scan on each channel. Allowed values are 0..5, with the scan times as specified by 802.15.4 (0 = 31ms, 1 = 46ms, 2 = 77ms, 3 = 138ms, 4 = 261ms, 5 = 507ms).

parameter.name: scanCount
parameter.description: The number of scans to be performed on each channel (1..8).

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: energyScanResultHandler
command.description: Reports the result of an energy scan for a single channel. The scan is not complete until the scanCompleteHandler callback is called.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: The 802.15.4 channel number that was scanned

parameter.name: maxRssiValue
parameter.description: The maximum RSSI value found on the channel.

command.name: networkFoundHandler
command.description: Reports that a network was found as a result of a prior call to startScan. Gives the network parameters useful for deciding which network to join.

parameter.name: networkFound
parameter.description: The parameters associated with the network found.

parameter.name: lastHopLqi
parameter.description: The link quality from the node that generated this beacon.

parameter.name: lastHopRssi
parameter.description: The energy level (in units of dBm) observed during the reception.

command.name: scanCompleteHandler
command.description: Returns the status of the current scan of type EZSP_ENERGY_SCAN or EZSP_ACTIVE_SCAN. EMBER_SUCCESS signals that the scan has completed. Other error conditions signify a failure to scan on the channel specified.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: The channel on which the current error occurred. Undefined for the case of EMBER_SUCCESS.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The error condition that occurred on the current channel. Value will be EMBER_SUCCESS when the scan has completed.

command.name: stopScan
command.description: Terminates a scan in progress.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: formNetwork
command.description: Forms a new network by becoming the coordinator.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.description: Specification of the new network.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: permitJoining
command.description: Tells the stack to allow other nodes to join the network with this node as their parent. Joining is initially disabled by default.

parameter.name: duration
parameter.description: A value of 0x00 disables joining. A value of 0xFF enables joining. Any other value enables joining for that number of seconds.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: removeDevice
command.description: This command sends an APS remove device using APS encryption to the destination indicating either to remove itself from the network, or one of its children.

parameter.name: destShort
parameter.description: The node ID of the device that will receive the message

parameter.name: destLong
parameter.description: The long address (EUI64) of the device that will receive the message.

parameter.name: targetLong
parameter.description: The long address (EUI64) of the device to be removed.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success, or the reason for failure

command.name: networkState
command.description: Returns a value indicating whether the node is joining, joined to, or leaving a network.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberNetworkStatus value indicating the current join status.

command.name: childJoinHandler
command.description: Indicates that a child has joined or left.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the child of interest.

parameter.name: joining
parameter.description: True if the child is joining. False the child is leaving.

parameter.name: childId
parameter.description: The node ID of the child.

parameter.name: childEui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the child.

parameter.name: childType
parameter.description: The node type of the child.

command.name: getNetworkParameters
command.description: Returns the current network parameters.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

parameter.name: nodeType
parameter.description: An EmberNodeType value indicating the current node type.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.description: The current network parameters.

command.name: getParentChildParameters
command.description: Returns information about the children of the local node and the parent of the local node.

parameter.name: childCount
parameter.description: The number of children the node currently has.

parameter.name: parentEui64
parameter.description: The parent's EUI64. The value is undefined for nodes without parents (coordinators and nodes that are not joined to a network)

parameter.name: parentNodeId
parameter.description: The parent's node ID. The value is undefined for nodes without parents (coordinators and nodes that are not joined to a network).

command.name: getChildData
command.description: Returns information about a child of the local node.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the child of interest in the child table. Possible indexes range from zero to EMBER_CHILD_TABLE_SIZE.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS if there is a child at index. EMBER_NOT_JOINED if there is no child at index.

parameter.name: childId
parameter.description: The node ID of the child.

parameter.name: childEui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the child

parameter.name: childType
parameter.description: The EmberNodeType value for the child.

command.name: getNeighbor
command.description: Returns the neighbor table entry at the given index. The number of active neighbors can be obtained using the neighborCount command.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the neighbor of interest. Neighbors are stored in ascending order by node id, with all unused entries at the end of the table.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_ERR_FATAL if the index is greater or equal to the number of active neighbors, or if the device is an end device. Returns EMBER_SUCCESS otherwise.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The contents of the neighbor table entry.

command.name: neighborCount
command.description: Returns the number of active entries in the neighbor table.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The number of active entries in the neighbor table

command.name: getRouteTableEntry
command.description: Returns the route table entry at the given index. The route table size can be obtained using the getConfigurationValue command.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the route table entry of interest

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_ERR_FATAL if the index is out of range or the device is an end device, and EMBER_SUCCESS otherwise.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The contents of the route table entry.

command.name: setRadioChannel
command.description: Sets the channel to use for sending and receiving messages. For a list of available radio channels, see the technical specification for the RF communication module in your Developer Kit. Note: Care should be taken when using this API, as all devices on a network must use the same channel.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: Desired radio channel.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating the success or failure of the command.

command.name: setRadioPower
command.description: Sets the radio output power at which a node is operating. Ember radios have discrete power settings. For a list of available power settings, see the technical specification for the RF communication module in your Developer Kit. Note: Care should be taken when using this API on a running network, as it will directly impact the established link qualities neighboring nodes have with the node on which it is called. This can lead to disruption of existing routes and erratic network behavior.

parameter.name: power
parameter.description: Desired radio output power, in dBm.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating the success or failure of the command.

command.name: clearBindingTable
command.description: Deletes all binding table entries.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating the success or failure of the command.

command.name: setBinding
command.description: Sets an entry in the binding table.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The contents of the binding entry.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating the success or failure of the command.

command.name: getBinding
command.description: Gets an entry in the binding table.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating the success or failure of the command.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: The contents of the binding entry.

command.name: deleteBinding
command.description: Deletes an entry in the binding table.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating the success or failure of the command.

command.name: bindingIsActive
command.description: Indicates whether any messages are currently being sent using this binding table entry. Note that this command does not indicate whether a binding is clear. To determine whether a binding is clear, check whether the type field of the EmberBindingTableEntry has the value EMBER_UNUSED_BINDING.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: active
parameter.description: True if the binding table entry is active, false otherwise.

command.name: getBindingRemoteNodeId
command.description: Returns the node ID for the binding's destination, if the ID is known. If a message is sent using the binding and the destination's ID is not known, the stack will discover the ID by broadcasting a ZDO address request. The application can avoid the need for this discovery by using setBindingRemoteNodeId when it knows the correct ID via some other means. The destination's node ID is forgotten when the binding is changed, when the local node reboots or, much more rarely, when the destination node changes its ID in response to an ID conflict.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: nodeId
parameter.description: The short ID of the destination node or EMBER_NULL_NODE_ID if no destination is known.

command.name: setBindingRemoteNodeId
command.description: Set the node ID for the binding's destination. See getBindingRemoteNodeId for a description.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: nodeId
parameter.description: The short ID of the destination node.

command.name: remoteSetBindingHandler
command.description: The NCP used the external binding modification policy to decide how to handle a remote set binding request. The Host cannot change the current decision, but it can change the policy for future decisions using the setPolicy command.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.description: The requested binding.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: policyDecision
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS if the binding was added to the table and any other status if not.

command.name: remoteDeleteBindingHandler
command.description: The NCP used the external binding modification policy to decide how to handle a remote delete binding request. The Host cannot change the current decision, but it can change the policy for future decisions using the setPolicy command.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of a binding table entry.

parameter.name: policyDecision
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS if the binding was removed from the table and any other status if not.

command.name: sendUnicast
command.description: Sends a unicast message as per the ZigBee specification. The message will arrive at its destination only if there is a known route to the destination node. Setting the ENABLE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY option will cause a route to be discovered if none is known. Setting the FORCE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY option will force route discovery. Routes to end-device children of the local node are always known. Setting the APS_RETRY option will cause the message to be retransmitted until either a matching acknowledgement is received or three transmissions have been made. Note: Using the FORCE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY option will cause the first transmission to be consumed by a route request as part of discovery, so the application payload of this packet will not reach its destination on the first attempt. If you want the packet to reach its destination, the APS_RETRY option must be set so that another attempt is made to transmit the message with its application payload after the route has been constructed. Note: When sending fragmented messages, the stack will only assign a new APS sequence number for the first fragment of the message (i.e., EMBER_APS_OPTION_FRAGMENT is set and the low-order byte of the groupId field in the APS frame is zero). For all subsequent fragments of the same message, the application must set the sequence number field in the APS frame to the sequence number assigned by the stack to the first fragment.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: Specifies the outgoing message type. Must be one of EMBER_OUTGOING_DIRECT, EMBER_OUTGOING_VIA_ADDRESS_TABLE, or EMBER_OUTGOING_VIA_BINDING.

parameter.name: indexOrDestination
parameter.description: Depending on the type of addressing used, this is either the EmberNodeId of the destination, an index into the address table, or an index into the binding table.

parameter.name: apsFrame
parameter.description: The APS frame which is to be added to the message.

parameter.name: messageTag
parameter.description: A value chosen by the Host. This value is used in the ezspMessageSentHandler response to refer to this message.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: Content of the message.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.description: The sequence number that will be used when this message is transmitted.

command.name: sendBroadcast
command.description: Sends a broadcast message as per the ZigBee specification.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: The destination to which to send the broadcast. This must be one of the three ZigBee broadcast addresses.

parameter.name: apsFrame
parameter.description: The APS frame which is to be added to the message.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: The message will be delivered to all nodes within radius hops of the sender. A radius of zero is converted to EMBER_MAX_HOPS.

parameter.name: messageTag
parameter.description: A value chosen by the Host. This value is used in the ezspMessageSentHandler response to refer to this message.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: Content of the message.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.description: The sequence number that will be used when this message is transmitted.

command.name: sendReply
command.description: Sends a reply to a received unicast message. The incomingMessageHandler callback for the unicast being replied to supplies the values for all the parameters except the reply itself.

parameter.name: sender
parameter.description: Value supplied by incoming unicast.

parameter.name: apsFrame
parameter.description: Value supplied by incoming unicast.

parameter.name: messageTag
parameter.description: A value chosen by the Host. This value is used in the ezspMessageSentHandler response to refer to this message.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: The reply message.

parameter.name: policyDecision
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value. EMBER_INVALID_CALL - The EZSP_UNICAST_REPLIES_POLICY is set to EZSP_HOST_WILL_NOT_SUPPLY_REPLY. This means the NCP will automatically send an empty reply. The Host must change the policy to EZSP_HOST_WILL_SUPPLY_REPLY before it can supply the reply. There is one exception to this rule: In the case of responses to message fragments, the host must call sendReply when a message fragment is received. In this case, the policy set on the NCP does not matter. The NCP expects a sendReply call from the Host for message fragments regardless of the current policy settings. EMBER_NO_BUFFERS - Not enough memory was available to send the reply. EMBER_NETWORK_BUSY - Either no route or insufficient resources available. EMBER_SUCCESS - The reply was successfully queued for transmission.

command.name: sendMulticast
command.description: Sends a multicast message to all endpoints that share a specific multicast ID and are within a specified number of hops of the sender.

parameter.name: apsFrame
parameter.description: The APS frame for the message. The multicast will be sent to the groupId in this frame.

parameter.name: hops
parameter.description: The message will be delivered to all nodes within this number of hops of the sender. A value of zero is converted to EMBER_MAX_HOPS.

parameter.name: nonmemberRadius
parameter.description: The number of hops that the message will be forwarded by devices that are not members of the group. A value of 7 or greater is treated as infinite.

parameter.name: messageTag
parameter.description: A value chosen by the Host. This value is used in the ezspMessageSentHandler response to refer to this message.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: The multicast message.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value. For any result other than EMBER_SUCCESS, the message will not be sent. EMBER_SUCCESS - The message has been submitted for transmission. EMBER_INVALID_BINDING_INDEX - The bindingTableIndex refers to a non-multicast binding. EMBER_NETWORK_DOWN - The node is not part of a network. EMBER_MESSAGE_TOO_LONG - The message is too large to fit in a MAC layer frame. EMBER_NO_BUFFERS - The free packet buffer pool is empty. EMBER_NETWORK_BUSY - Insufficient resources available in Network or MAC layers to send message.

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.description: The sequence number that will be used when this message is transmitted.

command.name: messageSentHandler
command.description: A callback indicating the stack has completed sending a message.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of message sent.

parameter.name: indexOrDestination
parameter.description: The destination to which the message was sent, for direct unicasts, or the address table or binding index for other unicasts. The value is unspecified for multicasts and broadcasts.

parameter.name: apsFrame
parameter.description: The APS frame for the message.

parameter.name: messageTag
parameter.description: The value supplied by the Host in the ezspSendUnicast, ezspSendBroadcast or ezspSendMulticast command.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value of EMBER_SUCCESS if an ACK was received from the destination or EMBER_DELIVERY_FAILED if no ACK was received.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: The unicast message supplied by the Host. The message contents are only included here if the decision for the messageContentsInCallback policy is messageTagAndContentsInCallback.

command.name: sendManyToOneRouteRequest
command.description: Sends a route request packet that creates routes from every node in the network back to this node. This function should be called by an application that wishes to communicate with many nodes, for example, a gateway, central monitor, or controller. A device using this function was referred to as an 'aggregator' in EmberZNet 2.x and earlier, and is referred to as a 'concentrator' in the ZigBee specification and EmberZNet 3. This function enables large scale networks, because the other devices do not have to individually perform bandwidth-intensive route discoveries. Instead, when a remote node sends an APS unicast to a concentrator, its network layer automatically delivers a special route record packet first, which lists the network ids of all the intermediate relays. The concentrator can then use source routing to send outbound APS unicasts. (A source routed message is one in which the entire route is listed in the network layer header.) This allows the concentrator to communicate with thousands of devices without requiring large route tables on neighboring nodes. This function is only available in ZigBee Pro (stack profile 2), and cannot be called on end devices. Any router can be a concentrator (not just the coordinator), and there can be multiple concentrators on a network. Note that a concentrator does not automatically obtain routes to all network nodes after calling this function. Remote applications must first initiate an inbound APS unicast. Many-to-one routes are not repaired automatically. Instead, the concentrator application must call this function to rediscover the routes as necessary, for example, upon failure of a retried APS message. The reason for this is that there is no scalable one-size-fits-all route repair strategy. A common and recommended strategy is for the concentrator application to refresh the routes by calling this function periodically.

parameter.name: concentratorType
parameter.description: Must be either EMBER_HIGH_RAM_CONCENTRATOR or EMBER_LOW_RAM_CONCENTRATOR. The former is used when the caller has enough memory to store source routes for the whole network. In that case, remote nodes stop sending route records once the concentrator has successfully received one. The latter is used when the concentrator has insufficient RAM to store all outbound source routes. In that case, route records are sent to the concentrator prior to every inbound APS unicast.

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: The maximum number of hops the route request will be relayed. A radius of zero is converted to EMBER_MAX_HOPS.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS if the route request was successfully submitted to the transmit queue, and EMBER_ERR_FATAL otherwise.

command.name: pollHandler
command.description: Indicates that the local node received a data poll from a child.

parameter.name: senderEui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the sender.

command.name: incomingRouteErrorHandler
command.description: A callback invoked when a route error message is received. The error indicates that a problem routing to or from the target node was encountered.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SOURCE_ROUTE_FAILURE or EMBER_MANY_TO_ONE_ROUTE_FAILURE.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The short id of the remote node.

command.name: incomingMessageHandler
command.description: A callback indicating a message has been received.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of the incoming message. One of the following: EMBER_INCOMING_UNICAST, EMBER_INCOMING_UNICAST_REPLY, EMBER_INCOMING_MULTICAST, EMBER_INCOMING_MULTICAST_LOOPBACK, EMBER_INCOMING_BROADCAST, EMBER_INCOMING_BROADCAST_LOOPBACK

parameter.name: apsFrame
parameter.description: The APS frame for the message.

parameter.name: lastHopLqi
parameter.description: The link quality from the node that last relayed the message.

parameter.name: lastHopRssi
parameter.description: The energy level (in units of dBm) observed during the reception.

parameter.name: sender
parameter.description: The sender of the message.

parameter.name: bindingIndex
parameter.description: The index of a binding that matches the message or 0xFF if there is no matching binding.

parameter.name: addressIndex
parameter.description: The index of the entry in the address table that matches the sender of the message or 0xFF if there is no matching entry.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: The incoming message.

command.name: macFilterMatchMessageHandler
command.description: A callback invoked by the EmberZNet stack when a raw MAC message that has matched one of the application's configured MAC filters.

parameter.name: filterIndexMatch
parameter.description: The index of the filter that was matched.

parameter.name: legacyPassthroughType
parameter.description: The type of MAC passthrough message received.

parameter.name: lastHopLqi
parameter.description: The link quality from the node that last relayed the message.

parameter.name: lastHopRssi
parameter.description: The energy level (in units of dBm) observed during reception.

parameter.name: messageLength
parameter.description: The length of the messageContents parameter in bytes.

parameter.name: messageContents
parameter.description: The raw message that was received.

command.name: trustCenterJoinHandler
command.description: The NCP used the trust center behavior policy to decide whether to allow a new node to join the network. The Host cannot change the current decision, but it can change the policy for future decisions using the setPolicy command.

parameter.name: newNodeId
parameter.description: The Node Id of the node whose status changed.

parameter.name: newNodeEui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the node whose status changed.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The status of the node: Secure Join/Rejoin, Unsecure Join/Rejoin, Device left.

parameter.name: policyDecision
parameter.description: An EmberJoinDecision reflecting the decision made.

parameter.name: parentOfNewNodeId
parameter.description: The parent of the node whose status has changed.

command.name: becomeTrustCenter
command.description: This function causes a coordinator to become the Trust Center when it is operating in a network that is not using one. It will send out an updated Network Key to all devices that will indicate a transition of the network to now use a Trust Center. The Trust Center should also switch all devices to using this new network key with the appropriate API.

parameter.name: newNetworkKey
parameter.description: The key data for the Updated Network Key.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The response status.

command.name: aesMmoHash
command.description: This routine processes the passed chunk of data and updates the hash context based on it. If the 'finalize' parameter is not set, then the length of the data passed in must be a multiple of 16. If the 'finalize' parameter is set then the length can be any value up 1-16, and the final hash value will be calculated.

parameter.name: context
parameter.description: The hash context to update.

parameter.name: finalize
parameter.description: This indicates whether the final hash value should be calculated.

parameter.name: length
parameter.description: The length of the data to hash.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: The data to hash.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the operation.

parameter.name: returnContext
parameter.description: The updated hash context.

command.name: setSourceRoute
command.description: Supply a source route for the next outgoing message.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: The destination of the source route.

parameter.name: relayCount
parameter.description: The number of relays in relayList.

parameter.name: relayList
parameter.description: The route record. Each relay in the list is an uint16_t node ID.

command.name: incomingRouteRecordHandler
command.description: Reports the arrival of a route record command frame.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: The source of the route record.

parameter.name: sourceEui
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the source.

parameter.name: lastHopLqi
parameter.description: The link quality from the node that last relayed the route record.

parameter.name: lastHopRssi
parameter.description: The energy level (in units of dBm) observed during the reception.

parameter.name: relayCount
parameter.description: The number of relays in relayList.

parameter.name: relayList
parameter.description: The route record. Each relay in the list is an uint16_t node ID.

command.name: incomingRouteErrorHandler
command.description: A callback invoked when a route error message is received. The error indicates that a problem routing to or from the target node was encountered.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SOURCE_ROUTE_FAILURE or EMBER_MANY_TO_ONE_ROUTE_FAILURE.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The short id of the remote node.

command.name: getAddressTableRemoteEui64
command.description: Gets the EUI64 of an address table entry.

parameter.name: addressTableIndex
parameter.description: The index of an address table entry.

parameter.name: eui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the address table entry is copied to this location.

command.name: joinNetwork
command.description: Causes the stack to associate with the network using the specified network parameters. It can take several seconds for the stack to associate with the local network. Do not send messages until the stackStatusHandler callback informs you that the stack is up.

parameter.name: nodeType
parameter.description: Specification of the role that this node will have in the network. This role must not be EMBER_COORDINATOR. To be a coordinator, use the formNetwork command.

parameter.name: parameters
parameter.description: Specification of the network with which the node should associate.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: findAndRejoinNetwork
command.description: The application may call this function when contact with the network has been lost. The most common usage case is when an end device can no longer communicate with its parent and wishes to find a new one. Another case is when a device has missed a Network Key update and no longer has the current Network Key. The stack will call ezspStackStatusHandler to indicate that the network is down, then try to re-establish contact with the network by performing an active scan, choosing a network with matching extended pan id, and sending a ZigBee network rejoin request. A sec- ond call to the ezspStackStatusHandler callback indicates either the success or the failure of the attempt. The process takes approximately 150 milliseconds per channel to complete. This call replaces the emberMobileNodeHasMoved API from EmberZNet 2.x, which used MAC association and consequently took half a second longer to complete.

parameter.name: haveCurrentNetworkKey
parameter.description: This parameter tells the stack whether to try to use the current network key. If it has the current network key it will perform a secure rejoin (encrypted). If this fails the device should try an unsecure rejoin. If the Trust Center allows the rejoin then the current Network Key will be sent encrypted using the device's Link Key. The unsecured rejoin is only supported in the Commercial Security Library.

parameter.name: channelMask
parameter.description: A mask indicating the channels to be scanned. See emberStartScan for format details. A value of 0 is reinterpreted as the mask for the current channel.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: leaveNetwork
command.description: Causes the stack to leave the current network. This generates a stackStatusHandler callback to indicate that the network is down. The radio will not be used until after sending a formNetwork or joinNetwork command.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: setExtendedTimeout
command.description: Tells the stack whether or not the normal interval between retransmissions of a retried unicast message should be increased by EMBER_INDIRECT_TRANSMISSION_TIMEOUT. The interval needs to be increased when sending to a sleepy node so that the message is not retransmitted until the destination has had time to wake up and poll its parent. The stack will automatically extend the timeout: - For our own sleepy children. - When an address response is received from a parent on behalf of its child. - When an indirect transaction expiry route error is received. - When an end device announcement is received from a sleepy node.

parameter.name: remoteEui64
parameter.description: The address of the node for which the timeout is to be set.

parameter.name: extendedTimeout
parameter.description: true if the retry interval should be increased by EMBER_INDIRECT_TRANSMISSION_TIMEOUT. false if the normal retry interval should be used.

command.name: getExtendedTimeout
command.description: Indicates whether or not the stack will extend the normal interval between retransmissions of a retried unicast message by EMBER_INDIRECT_TRANSMISSION_TIMEOUT.

parameter.name: remoteEui64
parameter.description: The address of the node for which the timeout is to be returned.

parameter.name: extendedTimeout
parameter.description: true if the retry interval should be increased by EMBER_INDIRECT_TRANSMISSION_TIMEOUT. false if the normal retry interval should be used.

command.name: lookupNodeIdByEui64
command.description: Returns the node ID that corresponds to the specified EUI64. The node ID is found by searching through all stack tables for the specified EUI64.

parameter.name: eui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the node to look up.

parameter.name: nodeId
parameter.description: The short ID of the node or EMBER_NULL_NODE_ID if the short ID is not known.

command.name: lookupEui64ByNodeId
command.description: Returns the EUI64 that corresponds to the specified node ID. The EUI64 is found by searching through all stack tables for the specified node ID.

parameter.name: nodeId
parameter.description: The short ID of the node or EMBER_NULL_NODE_ID if the short ID is not known.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_SUCCESS if the EUI64 was found, EMBER_ERR_FATAL if the EUI64 is not known.

parameter.name: eui64
parameter.description: The EUI64 of the node to look up.

command.name: getKey
command.description: Gets a Security Key based on the passed key type.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of the operation.

parameter.name: keyStruct
parameter.description: The structure containing the key and its associated data.

command.name: getTransientLinkKey
command.description: This is a function to get the transient link key structure in the transient key table. The EUI of the passed in key structure is searched and, if a match is found, the rest of the key structure is filled in.

parameter.name: eui
parameter.description: The IEEE address to look up the transient key for.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of getting the transient key.

parameter.name: transientKeyData
parameter.description: The transient key structure that is filled in upon success.

command.name: getTransientKeyTableEntry
command.description: Gets the transient link key at the index specified in the transient key table.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index in the transient key table to fetch data from.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of getting the transient key.

parameter.name: transientKeyData
parameter.description: The transient key structure that is filled in upon success.

command.name: switchNetworkKeyHandler
command.description: A callback to inform the application that the Network Key has been updated and the node has been switched over to use the new key. The actual key being used is not passed up, but the sequence number is.

parameter.name: sequenceNumber
parameter.description: The sequence number of the new network key.

command.name: zigbeeKeyEstablishmentHandler
command.description: This is a callback that indicates the success or failure of an attempt to establish a key with a partner device.

parameter.name: partner
parameter.description: This is the IEEE address of the partner that the device successfully established a key with. This value is all zeros on a failure.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This is the status indicating what was established or why the key establishment failed.

command.name: getKeyTableEntry
command.description: Retrieves the key table entry at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the entry in the table to retrieve.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_TABLE_ENTRY_ERASED if the index is an erased key entry. EMBER_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE if the passed index is not valid. EMBER_SUCCESS on success.

parameter.name: keyStruct
parameter.description: The results retrieved by the stack.

command.name: setKeyTableEntry
command.description: Sets the key table entry at the specified index.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index of the entry in the table to set.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The address of the partner device that shares the key

parameter.name: linkKey
parameter.description: This indicates whether the key is a Link or a Master Key

parameter.name: keyStruct
parameter.description: The actual key data associated with the table entry.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: EMBER_KEY_INVALID if the passed key data is using one of the reserved key values. EMBER_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE if passed index is not valid. EMBER_SUCCESS on success.

command.name: findKeyTableEntry
command.description: This function searches through the Key Table and tries to find the entry that matches the passed search criteria.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The address to search for. Alternatively, all zeros may be passed in to search for the first empty entry.

parameter.name: linkKey
parameter.description: This indicates whether to search for an entry that contains a link key or a master key. truemeans to search for an entry with a Link Key.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This indicates the index of the entry that matches the search criteria. A value of 0xFF is returned if not matching entry is found.

command.name: addOrUpdateKeyTableEntry
command.description: This function updates an existing entry in the key table or adds a new one. It first searches the table for an existing entrythat matches the passed EUI64 address. If no entry is found, it searches for the first free entry. If successful, it updates the key data and resets the associated incoming frame counter. If it fails to find an existing entry and no free one exists, it returns a failure.

parameter.name: address
parameter.description: The address of the partner device that shares the key

parameter.name: linkKey
parameter.description: This indicates whether the key is a Link or a Master Key

parameter.name: keyData
parameter.description: The actual key data associated with the entry.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure error code of the operation.

command.name: eraseKeyTableEntry
command.description: This function erases the data in the key table entry at the specified index. If the index is invalid, falseis returned.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: This indicates the index of entry to erase.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of the operation.

command.name: clearKeyTable
command.description: This function clears the key table of the current network.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of the operation.

command.name: addTransientLinkKey
command.description: This is a function to add a temporary link key for a joining device. The key will get timed out after a defined timeout period if the device does not update its link key with the Trust Center.

parameter.name: partner
parameter.description: This is the IEEE address of the partner that the device successfully established a key with. This value is all zeros on a failure.

parameter.name: transientKey
parameter.description: The transient key data for the joining device.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of adding a transient key.

command.name: clearTransientLinkKeys
command.description: Clear all of the transient link keys from RAM.

command.name: zigbeeKeyEstablishmentHandler
command.description: This is a callback that indicates the success or failure of an attempt to establish a key with a partner device.

parameter.name: partner
parameter.description: This is the IEEE address of the partner that the device successfully established a key with. This value is all zeros on a failure.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: This is the status indicating what was established or why the key establishment failed.

command.name: idConflictHandler
command.description: A callback invoked by the EmberZNet stack when an id conflict is discovered, that is, two different nodes in the network were found to be using the same short id. The stack automatically removes the conflicting short id from its internal tables (address, binding, route, neighbor, and child tables). The application should discontinue any other use of the id.

parameter.name: id
parameter.description: The short id for which a conflict was detected.

command.name: resetToFactoryDefaults
command.description: Reset the NCP to factory default.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EzspStatus value indicating success or the reason for failure.

command.name: setInitialSecurityState
command.description: Sets the security state that will be used by the device when it forms or joins the network. This call should not be used when restoring saved network state via networkInit as this will result in a loss of security data and will cause communication problems when the device re-enters the network.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The security configuration to be set.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: getCurrentSecurityState
command.description: Gets the current security state that is being used by a device that is joined in the network.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

parameter.name: state
parameter.description: The security configuration in use by the stack.

command.name: mfglibStart
command.description: Activate use of mfglib test routines and enables the radio receiver to report packets it receives to the mfgLibRxHandler() callback. These packets will not be passed up with a CRC failure. All other mfglib functions will return an error until the mfglibStart() has been called

parameter.name: rxCallback
parameter.description: true to generate a mfglibRxHandler callback when a packet is received.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibEnd
command.description: Deactivate use of mfglib test routines; restores the hardware to the state it was in prior to mfglibStart() and stops receiving packets started by mfglibStart() at the same time.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibStartTone
command.description: Starts transmitting an unmodulated tone on the currently set channel and power level. Upon successful return, the tone will be transmitting. To stop transmitting tone, application must call mfglibStopTone(), allowing it the flexibility to determine its own criteria for tone duration (time, event, etc.)

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibStopTone
command.description: Stops transmitting tone started by mfglibStartTone().

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibStartStream
command.description: Starts transmitting a random stream of characters. This is so that the radio modulation can be measured.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibStopStream
command.description: Stops transmitting a random stream of characters started by mfglibStartStream().

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibSetChannel
command.description: Sets the radio channel. Calibration occurs if this is the first time the channel has been used.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: The current channel.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibSendPacket
command.description: Sends a single packet consisting of the following bytes: packetLength, packetContents[0], ... , packetContents[pack-etLength - 3], CRC[0], CRC[1]. The total number of bytes sent is packetLength + 1. The radio replaces the last two bytes of packetContents[]with the 16-bit CRC for the packet.

parameter.name: packetLength
parameter.description: The current channel.

parameter.name: packetContents
parameter.description: The packet to send. The last two bytes will be replacedwith the 16-bit CRC.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibGetChannel
command.description: Returns the current radio channel, as previously set via mfglibSetChannel().

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: The current channel.

command.name: mfglibSetPower
command.description: First select the transmit power mode, and then include a method for selecting the radio transmit power. The valid power settings depend upon the specific radio in use. Ember radios have discrete power settings, and then requested power is rounded to a valid power setting; the actual power output is available to the caller via mfglibGetPower().

parameter.name: txPowerMode
parameter.description: Power mode.

parameter.name: power
parameter.description: Power in units of dBm. Refer to radio data sheet for valid range.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure code of the operation.

command.name: mfglibGetPower
command.description: Returns the current radio power setting, as previously set via mfglibSetPower().

parameter.name: power
parameter.description: Power in units of dBm. Refer to radio data sheet for valid range.

command.name: mfglibRxHandler
command.description: A callback indicating a packet with a valid CRC has been received.

parameter.name: linkQuality
parameter.description: The link quality observed during the reception.

parameter.name: rssi
parameter.description: The energy level (in units of dBm) observed during the reception.

parameter.name: packetLength
parameter.description: The length of the packetContents parameter in bytes. Will be greater than 3 and less than 123.

parameter.name: packetContents
parameter.description: The received packet. The last two bytes are the 16-bit CRC.

command.name: gpProxyTableProcessGpPairing
command.description: Update the GP Proxy table based on a GP pairing.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: The options field of the GP Pairing command.

parameter.name: addr
parameter.description: The target GPD.

parameter.name: commMode
parameter.description: The communication mode of the GP Sink.

parameter.name: sinkNetworkAddress
parameter.description: The network address of the GP Sink.

parameter.name: sinkGroupId
parameter.description: The group ID of the GP Sink.

parameter.name: assignedAlias
parameter.description: The alias assigned to the GPD.

parameter.name: sinkIeeeAddress
parameter.description: The IEEE address of the GP Sink.

parameter.name: gpdKey
parameter.description: The key to use for the target GPD.

parameter.name: gpPairingAdded
parameter.description: Whether a GP Pairing has been created or not.

command.name: dGpSend
command.description: Adds/removes an entry from the GP Tx Queue.

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: The action to perform on the GP TX queue (true to add, false to remove).

parameter.name: useCca
parameter.description: Whether to use ClearChannelAssessment when transmitting the GPDF.

parameter.name: addr
parameter.description: The Address of the destination GPD.

parameter.name: gpdCommandId

command.name: generateCbkeKeys
command.description: This call starts the generation of the ECC Ephemeral Public/Private key pair. When complete it stores the private key. The results are returned via ezspGenerateCbkeKeysHandler().

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

command.name: generateCbkeKeysHandler
command.description: A callback by the Crypto Engine indicating that a new ephemeral public/private key pair has been generated. The pub- lic/private key pair is stored on the NCP, but only the associated public key is returned to the host. The node's associated certificate is also returned.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

parameter.name: ephemeralPublicKey
parameter.description: The generated ephemeral public key.

command.name: calculateSmacs
command.description: Calculates the SMAC verification keys for both the initiator and responder roles of CBKE using the passed parameters and the stored public/private key pair previously generated with ezspGenerateKeysRetrieveCert(). It also stores the unverified link key data in temporary storage on the NCP until the key establishment is complete.

parameter.name: amInitiator
parameter.description: The role of this device in the Key Establishment protocol.

parameter.name: partnerCertificate
parameter.description: The key establishment partner's implicit certificate.

parameter.name: partnerEphemeralPublicKey
parameter.description: The key establishment partner's ephemeral public key

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

command.name: calculateSmacsHandler
command.description: A callback to indicate that the NCP has finished calculating the Secure Message Authentication Codes (SMAC) for both the initiator and responder. The associated link key is kept in temporary storage until the host tells the NCP to store or discard the key via emberClearTemporaryDataMaybeStoreLinkKey().

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

parameter.name: initiatorSmac
parameter.description: The calculated value of the initiators SMAC.

parameter.name: responderSmac
parameter.description: The calculated value of the responders SMAC.

command.name: generateCbkeKeys283k1
command.description: This call starts the generation of the ECC 283k1 curve Ephemeral Public/Private key pair. When complete it stores the private key. The results are returned via ezspGenerateCbkeKeys283k1Handler().

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

command.name: generateCbkeKeys283k1Handler
command.description: A callback by the Crypto Engine indicating that a new 283k1 ephemeral public/private key pair has been generated. The public/private key pair is stored on the NCP, but only the associate public key is returned to the host. The nodes associated certificate is also returned.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

parameter.name: ephemeralPublicKey
parameter.description: The generated ephemeral public key.

command.name: calculateSmacs283k1
command.description: Calculates the SMAC verification keys for both the initiator and responder roles of CBKE for the 283k1 ECC curve using the passed parameters and the stored public/private key pair previously generated with ezspGenerateKeysRetrieveCert283k1(). It also stores the unverified link key data in temporary storage on the NCP until the key establishment is complete.

parameter.name: amInitiator
parameter.description: The role of this device in the Key Establishment protocol.

parameter.name: partnerCertificate
parameter.description: The key establishment partner's implicit certificate.

parameter.name: partnerEphemeralPublicKey
parameter.description: The key establishment partner's ephemeral public key

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

command.name: calculateSmacs283k1Handler
command.description: A callback to indicate that the NCP has finished calculating the Secure Message Authentication Codes (SMAC) for both the initiator and responder for the CBKE 283k1 Library. The associated link key is kept in temporary storage until the host tells the NCP to store or discard the key via emberClearTemporaryDataMaybeStoreLinkKey().

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

parameter.name: initiatorSmac
parameter.description: The calculated value of the initiators SMAC.

parameter.name: responderSmac
parameter.description: The calculated value of the responders SMAC.

command.name: clearTemporaryDataMaybeStoreLinkKey
command.description: Clears the temporary data associated with CBKE and the key establishment, most notably the ephemeral public/private key pair. If storeLinKey is true it moves the unverified link key stored in temporary storage into the link key table. Otherwise it discards the key.

parameter.name: storeLinkKey
parameter.description: A bool indicating whether to store (true) or discard (false) the unverified link key derived when ezspCalculateSmacs() was previously called.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

command.name: clearTemporaryDataMaybeStoreLinkKey283k1
command.description: Clears the temporary data associated with CBKE and the key establishment, most notably the ephemeral public/private key pair. If storeLinKey is true it moves the unverified link key stored in temporary storage into the link key table. Otherwise it discards the key.

parameter.name: storeLinkKey
parameter.description: A bool indicating whether to store (true) or discard (false) the unverified link key derived when ezspCalculateSmacs() was previously called.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The result of the CBKE operation.

parameter.name: status

command.name: requestLinkKey
command.description: A function to request a Link Key from the Trust Center with another device on the Network (which could be the Trust Center). A Link Key with the Trust Center is possible but the requesting device cannot be the Trust Center. Link Keys are optional in ZigBee Standard Security and thus the stack cannot know whether the other device supports them. If EMBER_REQUEST_KEY_TIMEOUT is non-zero on the Trust Center and the partner device is not the Trust Center, both devices must request keys with their partner device within the time period. The Trust Center only supports one outstanding key request at a time and therefore will ignore other requests. If the timeout is zero then the Trust Center will immediately respond and not wait for the second request. The Trust Center will always immediately respond to requests for a Link Key with it. Sleepy devices should poll at a higher rate until a response is received or the request times out. The success or failure of the request is returned via ezspZigbeeKeyEstablishmentHandler(...).

parameter.name: partner
parameter.description: This is the IEEE address of the partner device that will share the link key.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: The success or failure of sending the request. This is not the final result of the attempt. ezspZigbeeKeyEstablishmentHandler(...) will return that.

command.name: sendTrustCenterLinkKey
command.description: This function sends an APS TransportKey command containing the current trust center link key. The node to which the command is sent is specified via the short and long address arguments.

parameter.name: destinationNodeId
parameter.description: The short address of the node to which this command will be sent

parameter.name: destinationEui64
parameter.description: The long address of the node to which this command will be sent

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: An EmberStatus value indicating success of failure of the operation
