structure.name: EmberNetworkParameters
structure.description: Network parameters.

parameter.name: extendedPanId
parameter.description: The network's extended PAN identifier.

parameter.name: panId
parameter.description: The network's PAN identifier.

parameter.name: radioTxPower
parameter.description: A power setting, in dBm.

parameter.name: radioChannel
parameter.description: A radio channel.

parameter.name: joinMethod
parameter.description: The method used to initially join the network

parameter.name: nwkManagerId
parameter.description: NWK Manager ID. The ID of the network manager in the current network. This may only be set at joining when using EMBER_USE_NWK_COMMISSIONING as the join method.

parameter.name: nwkUpdateId
parameter.description: NWK Update ID. The value of the ZigBee nwkUpdateId known by the stack. This is used to determine the newest instance of the network after a PAN ID or channel change. This may only be set at joining when using EMBER_USE_NWK_COMMISSIONING as the join method.

parameter.name: channels
parameter.description: NWK channel mask. The list of preferred channels that the NWK manager has told this device to use when searching for the network. This may only be set at joining when using EMBER_USE_NWK_COMMISSIONING as the join method.

structure.name: EmberZigbeeNetwork
structure.description: The parameters of a ZigBee network.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.description: The 802.15.4 channel associated with the network.

parameter.name: panId
parameter.description: The network's PAN identifier

parameter.name: extendedPanId
parameter.description: The network's extended PAN identifier.

parameter.name: allowingJoin
parameter.description: Whether the network is allowing MAC associations.

parameter.name: stackProfile
parameter.description: The Stack Profile associated with the network.

parameter.name: nwkUpdateId
parameter.description: The instance of the Network.

structure.name: EmberApsFrame
structure.description: ZigBee APS frame parameters.

parameter.name: profileId
parameter.description: The application profile ID that describes the format of the message.

parameter.name: clusterId
parameter.description: The cluster ID for this message

parameter.name: sourceEndpoint
parameter.description: The source endpoint.

parameter.name: destinationEndpoint
parameter.description: The destination endpoint.

parameter.name: options
parameter.description: A bitmask of options.

parameter.name: groupId
parameter.description: The group ID for this message, if it is multicast mode.

parameter.name: sequence
parameter.description: The sequence number.

structure.name: EmberNeighborTableEntry
structure.description: A neighbor table entry stores information about the reliability of RF links to and from neighboring nodes.

parameter.name: shortId
parameter.description: The neighbor's two byte network id.

parameter.name: averageLqi
parameter.description: An exponentially weighted moving average of the link quality values of incoming packets from this neighbor as reported by the PHY.

parameter.name: inCost
parameter.description: The incoming cost for this neighbor, computed from the average LQI. Values range from 1 for a good link to 7 for a bad link.

parameter.name: outCost
parameter.description: The outgoing cost for this neighbor, obtained from the most recently received neighbor exchange message from the neighbor. A value of zero means that a neighbor exchange message from the neighbor has not been received recently enough, or that our id was not present in the most recently received one.

parameter.name: age
parameter.description: The number of aging periods elapsed since a link status message was last received from this neighbor. The aging period is 16 seconds.

parameter.name: longId
parameter.description: The 8 byte EUI64 of the neighbor.

structure.name: EmberInitialSecurityState
structure.description: The security data used to set the configuration for the stack, or the retrieved configuration currently in use.

parameter.name: bitmask
parameter.description: A bitmask indicating the security state used to indicate what the security configuration will be when the device forms or joins the network.

parameter.name: preconfiguredKey
parameter.description: The pre-configured Key data that should be used when forming or joining the network. The security bitmask must be set with the EMBER_HAVE_PRECONFIGURED_KEY bit to indicate that the key contains valid data.

parameter.name: networkKey
parameter.description: The Network Key that should be used by the Trust Center when it forms the network, or the Network Key currently in use by a joined device. The security bitmask must be set with EMBER_HAVE_NETWORK_KEY to indicate that the key contains valid data.

parameter.name: networkKeySequenceNumber
parameter.description: The sequence number associated with the network key. This is only valid if the EMBER_HAVE_NETWORK_KEY has been set in the security bitmask.

parameter.name: preconfiguredTrustCenterEui64
parameter.description: This is the long address of the trust center on the network that will be joined. It is usually NOT set prior to joining the network and instead it is learned during the joining message exchange. This field is only examined if EMBER_HAVE_TRUST_CENTER_EUI64 is set in the EmberInitialSecurityState::bitmask. Most devices should clear that bit and leave this field alone. This field must be set when using commissioning mode.

structure.name: EmberRouteTableEntry
structure.description: A route table entry stores information about the next hop along the route to the destination.

parameter.name: destination
parameter.description: The short id of the destination. A value of 0xFFFF indicates the entry is unused.

parameter.name: nextHop
parameter.description: The short id of the next hop to this destination.

parameter.name: status
parameter.description: Indicates whether this entry is active (0), being discovered (1), unused (3), or validating (4).

parameter.name: age
parameter.description: The number of seconds since this route entry was last used to send a packet.

parameter.name: concentratorType
parameter.description: Indicates whether this destination is a High RAM Concentrator (2), a Low RAM Concentrator (1), or not a concentrator (0).

parameter.name: routeRecordState
parameter.description: For a High RAM Concentrator, indicates whether a route record is needed (2), has been sent (1), or is no long needed (0) because a source routed message from the concentrator has been received.

structure.name: EmberBindingTableEntry
structure.description: An entry in the binding table.

parameter.name: type
parameter.description: The type of binding.

parameter.name: local
parameter.description: The endpoint on the local node.

parameter.name: clusterId
parameter.description: A cluster ID that matches one from the local endpoint's simple descriptor. This cluster ID is set by the provisioning application to indicate which part an endpoint's functionality is bound to this particular remote node and is used to distinguish between unicast and multicast bindings. Note that a binding can be used to send messages with any cluster ID, not just that listed in the binding.

parameter.name: remote
parameter.description: The endpoint on the remote node (specified by identifier).

parameter.name: identifier
parameter.description: A 64-bit identifier. This is either the destination EUI64 (for unicasts) or the 64-bit group address (for multicasts).

parameter.name: uint8_t
parameter.description: The index of the network the binding belongs to.

value.name: EZSP_TRUST_CENTER_POLICY
value.description: Controls trust center behavior.

value.name: EZSP_BINDING_MODIFICATION_POLICY
value.description: Controls how external binding modification requests are handled.

value.name: EZSP_UNICAST_REPLIES_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether the Host supplies unicast replies.

value.name: EZSP_POLL_HANDLER_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether pollHandler callbacks are generated.

value.name: EZSP_MESSAGE_CONTENTS_IN_CALLBACK_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether the message contents are included in the messageSentHandler callback.

value.name: EZSP_TC_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether the Trust Center will respond to Trust Center link key requests.

value.name: EZSP_APP_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether the Trust Center will respond to application link key requests.

value.name: EZSP_PACKET_VALIDATE_LIBRARY_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether ZigBee packets that appear invalid are automatically dropped by the stack. A counter will be incremented when this occurs.

value.name: EZSP_ZLL_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether the stack will process ZLL messages.

value.name: EZSP_TC_REJOINS_USING_WELL_KNOWN_KEY_POLICY
value.description: Controls whether Trust Center (insecure) rejoins for devices using the well-known link key are accepted. If rejoining using the well-known key is allowed, it is disabled again after emAllowTcRejoinsUsingWellKnownKeyTimeoutSec seconds.

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_DIRECT
value.description: Unicast sent directly to an EmberNodeId.

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_VIA_ADDRESS_TABLE
value.description: Unicast sent using an entry in the address table.

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_VIA_BINDING
value.description: Unicast sent using an entry in the binding table.

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_MULTICAST
value.description: Multicast message. This value is passed to emberMessageSentHandler() only. It may not be passed to emberSendUnicast().

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_MULTICAST_WITH_ALIAS
value.description: Aliased multicast message. This value is passed to emberMessageSentHandler() only. It may not be passed to emberSendUnicast().

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_BROADCAST_WITH_ALIAS
value.description: Aliased broadcast message. This value is passed to emberMessageSentHandler() only. It may not be passed to emberSendUnicast().

value.name: EMBER_OUTGOING_BROADCAST
value.description: Broadcast message. This value is passed to emberMessageSentHandler() only. It may not be passed to emberSendUnicast().

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_JOINS
value.description: Send the network key in the clear to all joining and rejoining devices.

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_PRECONFIGURED_KEY_JOINS
value.description: Send the network key encrypted with the joining or rejoining device's trust center link key. The trust center and any joining or rejoining device are assumed to share a link key, either preconfigured or obtained under a previous policy. This is the default value for the EZSP_TRUST_CENTER_POLICY.

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_REJOINS_ONLY
value.description: Send the network key encrypted with the rejoining device's trust center link key. The trust center and any rejoining device are assumed to share a link key, either preconfigured or obtained under a previous policy. No new devices are allowed to join.

value.name: EZSP_DISALLOW_ALL_JOINS_AND_REJOINS
value.description: Reject all unsecured join and rejoin attempts.

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_JOINS_REJOINS_HAVE_LINK_KEY
value.description: Send the network key in the clear to all joining devices. Rejoining devices are sent the network key encrypted with their trust center link key. The trust center and any rejoining device are assumed to share a link key, either preconfigured or obtained under a previous policy.

value.name: EZSP_IGNORE_TRUST_CENTER_REJOINS
value.description: Take no action on trust center rejoin attempts.

value.name: EZSP_BDB_JOIN_USES_INSTALL_CODE_KEY
value.description: Admit joins only if there is an entry in the transient key table. This corresponds to the Base Device Behavior specification where a Trust Center enforces all devices to join with an install code-derived link key.

value.name: EZSP_DISALLOW_BINDING_MODIFICATION
value.description: EZSP_BINDING_MODIFICATION_POLICY default decision. Do not allow the local binding table to be changed by remote nodes.

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_BINDING_MODIFICATION
value.description: EZSP_BINDING_MODIFICATION_POLICY decision. Allow remote nodes to change the local binding table.

value.name: EZSP_CHECK_BINDING_MODIFICATIONS_ARE_VALID_ENDPOINT_CLUSTERS
value.description: EZSP_BINDING_MODIFICATION_POLICY decision. Allows remote nodes to set local binding entries only if the entries correspond to endpoints defined on the device, and for output clusters bound to those endpoints.

value.name: EZSP_HOST_WILL_NOT_SUPPLY_REPLY
value.description: EZSP_UNICAST_REPLIES_POLICY default decision. The NCP will automatically send an empty reply (containing no payload) for every unicast received.

value.name: EZSP_HOST_WILL_SUPPLY_REPLY
value.description: EZSP_UNICAST_REPLIES_POLICY decision. The NCP will only send a reply if it receives a sendReply command from the Host.

value.name: EZSP_POLL_HANDLER_IGNORE
value.description: EZSP_POLL_HANDLER_POLICY default decision. Do not inform the Host when a child polls.

value.name: EZSP_POLL_HANDLER_CALLBACK
value.description: EZSP_POLL_HANDLER_POLICY decision. Generate a pollHandler callback when a child polls.

value.name: EZSP_MESSAGE_TAG_ONLY_IN_CALLBACK
value.description: EZSP_MESSAGE_CONTENTS_IN_CALLBACK_POLICY default decision. Include only the message tag in the messageSentHandler callback.

value.name: EZSP_MESSAGE_TAG_AND_CONTENTS_IN_CALLBACK
value.description: EZSP_MESSAGE_CONTENTS_IN_CALLBACK_POLICY decision. Include both the message tag and the message contents in the messageSentHandler callback.

value.name: EZSP_DENY_TC_KEY_REQUESTS
value.description: EZSP_TC_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY decision. When the Trust Center receives a request for a Trust Center link key, it will be ignored.

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_TC_KEY_REQUESTS
value.description: EZSP_TC_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY decision. When the Trust Center receives a request for a Trust Center link key, it will reply to it with the corresponding key.

value.name: EZSP_GENERATE_NEW_TC_LINK_KEY
value.description: EZSP_TC_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY decision. When the Trust Center receives a request for a Trust Center link key, it will generate a key to send to the joiner.

value.name: EZSP_DENY_APP_KEY_REQUESTS
value.description: EZSP_APP_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY decision. When the Trust Center receives a request for an application link key, it will be ignored.

value.name: EZSP_ALLOW_APP_KEY_REQUESTS
value.description: EZSP_APP_KEY_REQUEST_POLICY decision. When the Trust Center receives a request for an application link key, it will randomly generate a key and send it to both partners.

value.name: EZSP_PACKET_VALIDATE_LIBRARY_CHECKS_ENABLED
value.description: Indicates that packet validate library checks are enabled on the NCP.

value.name: EZSP_PACKET_VALIDATE_LIBRARY_CHECKS_DISABLED
value.description: Indicates that packet validate library checks are NOT enabled on the NCP.

value.name: EMBER_UNUSED_BINDING
value.description: A binding that is currently not in use.

value.name: EMBER_UNICAST_BINDING
value.description: A unicast binding whose 64-bit identifier is the destination EUI64.

value.name: EMBER_MANY_TO_ONE_BINDING
value.description: A unicast binding whose 64-bit identifier is the aggregator EUI64.

value.name: EMBER_MULTICAST_BINDING
value.description: A multicast binding whose 64-bit identifier is the group address. A multicast binding can be used to send messages to the group and to receive messages sent to the group.

value.name: EMBER_STANDARD_SECURITY_MODE
value.description: This denotes that the device is running in a network with ZigBee Standard Security.

value.name: EMBER_HIGH_SECURITY_MODE
value.description: This denotes that the device is running in a network with ZigBee High Security.

value.name: EMBER_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_CENTER_MODE
value.description: This denotes that the device is running in a network without a centralized Trust Center.

value.name: EMBER_GLOBAL_LINK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the device has a Global Link Key. The Trust Center Link Key is the same across multiple nodes.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the node has a Trust Center Link Key.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_USES_HASHED_LINK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the Trust Center is using a Hashed Link Key.

value.name: EMBER_PRECONFIG_KEY_NOT_VALID
value.description: If this bit is set, we set the 'key token data' field in the Initial Security Bitmask to 0 (No Preconfig Key token), otherwise we leave the field as it is.

value.name: EMBER_JOINER_GLOBAL_LINK_KEY
value.description: This denotes whether a joiner node (router or end-device) uses a Global Link Key or a Unique Link Key.

value.name: EMBER_EXT_NO_FRAME_COUNTER_RESET
value.description: This denotes whether the device's outgoing frame counter is allowed to be reset during forming or joining. If flag is set, the outgoing frame counter is not allowed to be reset. If flag is not set, the frame counter is allowed to be reset.

value.name: EMBER_NWK_LEAVE_REQUEST_NOT_ALLOWED
value.description: This denotes whether a router node should discard or accept network Leave Commands.

value.name: EZSP_SUCCESS
value.description: Success

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_FATAL
value.description: Fatal error

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_NCP_RESET
value.description: The Response frame of the current transaction indicates the NCP has reset.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_OVERSIZED_EZSP_FRAME
value.description: The NCP is reporting that the Command frame of the current transaction is oversized (the length byte is too large).

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_ABORTED_TRANSACTION
value.description: The Response frame of the current transaction indicates the previous transaction was aborted (nSSEL deasserted too soon).

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_MISSING_FRAME_TERMINATOR
value.description: The Response frame of the current transaction indicates the frame terminator is missing from the Command frame.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_WAIT_SECTION_TIMEOUT
value.description: The NCP has not provided a Response within the time limit defined by WAIT_SECTION_TIMEOUT.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_NO_FRAME_TERMINATOR
value.description: The Response frame from the NCP is missing the frame terminator.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_EZSP_COMMAND_OVERSIZED
value.description: The Host attempted to send an oversized Command (the length byte is too large) and the AVR's spi-protocol.c blocked the transmission.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_EZSP_RESPONSE_OVERSIZED
value.description: The NCP attempted to send an oversized Response (the length byte is too large) and the AVR's spi-protocol.c blocked the reception.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE
value.description: The Host has sent the Command and is still waiting for the NCP to send a Response.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT
value.description: The NCP has not asserted nHOST_INT within the time limit defined by WAKE_HANDSHAKE_TIMEOUT.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_STARTUP_TIMEOUT
value.description: The NCP has not asserted nHOST_INT after an NCP reset within the time limit defined by STARTUP_TIMEOUT.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_STARTUP_FAIL
value.description: The Host attempted to verify the SPI Protocol activity and version number, and the verification failed.

value.name: EZSP_SPI_ERR_UNSUPPORTED_SPI_COMMAND
value.description: The Host has sent a command with a SPI Byte that is unsupported by the current mode the NCP is operating in.

value.name: EZSP_ASH_IN_PROGRESS
value.description: Operation not yet complete.

value.name: EZSP_HOST_FATAL_ERROR
value.description: Fatal error detected by host.

value.name: EZSP_ASH_NCP_FATAL_ERROR
value.description: Fatal error detected by NCP.

value.name: EZSP_DATA_FRAME_TOO_LONG
value.description: Tried to send DATA frame too long.

value.name: EZSP_DATA_FRAME_TOO_SHORT
value.description: Tried to send DATA frame too short.

value.name: EZSP_NO_TX_SPACE
value.description: No space for tx'ed DATA frame.

value.name: EZSP_NO_RX_SPACE
value.description: No space for rec'd DATA frame.

value.name: EZSP_NO_RX_DATA
value.description: No receive data available.

value.name: EZSP_NOT_CONNECTED
value.description: Not in Connected state

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_VERSION_NOT_SET
value.description: The NCP received a command before the EZSP version had been set.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_FRAME_ID
value.description: The NCP received a command containing an unsupported frame ID

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_WRONG_DIRECTION
value.description: The direction flag in the frame control field was incorrect.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_TRUNCATED
value.description: The truncated flag in the frame control field was set, indicating there was not enough memory available to complete the response or that the response would have exceeded the maximum EZSP frame length.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_OVERFLOW
value.description: The overflow flag in the frame control field was set, indicating one or more callbacks occurred since the previous response and there was not enough memory available to report them to the Host.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_OUT_OF_MEMORY
value.description: Insufficient memory was available.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE
value.description: The value was out of bounds.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_ID
value.description: The configuration id was not recognized.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_INVALID_CALL
value.description: Configuration values can no longer be modified.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_NO_RESPONSE

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_COMMAND_TOO_LONG
value.description: The length of the command exceeded the maximum EZSP frame length.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_QUEUE_FULL
value.description: The UART receive queue was full causing a callback response to be dropped.

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_COMMAND_FILTERED

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_VERSION

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_TIMEOUTS

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_RESET_FAIL

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_NCP_RESET

value.name: EZSP_ERROR_SERIAL_INIT

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_NCP_TYPE

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_RESET_METHOD

value.name: EZSP_ASH_ERROR_XON_XOF
value.description: XON/XOFF not supported by host driver

value.name: EZSP_ASH_DISCONNECTED

value.name: EMBER_USE_MAC_ASSOCIATION
value.description: Normally devices use MAC Association to join a network, which respects the "permit joining" flag in the MAC Beacon. For mobile nodes this value causes the device to use an Ember Mobile Node Join, which is functionally equivalent to a MAC association. This value should be used by default.

value.name: EMBER_USE_NWK_REJOIN
value.description: For those networks where the "permit joining" flag is never turned on, they will need to use a ZigBee NWK Rejoin. This value causes the rejoin to be sent without NWK security and the Trust Center will be asked to send the NWK key to the device. The NWK key sent to the device can be encrypted with the device's corresponding Trust Center link key. That is determined by the ::EmberJoinDecision on the Trust Center returned by the ::emberTrustCenterJoinHandler(). For a mobile node this value will cause it to use an Ember Mobile node rejoin, which is functionally equivalent.

value.name: EMBER_USE_NWK_REJOIN_HAVE_NWK_KEY
value.description: For those networks where the "permit joining" flag is never turned on, they will need to use a NWK Rejoin. If those devices have been preconfigured with the NWK key (including sequence number) they can use a secured rejoin. This is only necessary for end devices since they need a parent. Routers can simply use the ::EMBER_USE_NWK_COMMISSIONING join method below.

value.name: EMBER_USE_NWK_COMMISSIONING
value.description: For those networks where all network and security information is known ahead of time, a router device may be commissioned such that it does not need to send any messages to begin communicating on the network.

value.name: EZSP_ENERGY_SCAN
value.description: An energy scan scans each channel for its RSSI value.

value.name: EZSP_ACTIVE_SCAN
value.description: An active scan scans each channel for available networks.

enum.name: EmberZdoConfigurationFlags
enum.description: This is a bitmask that controls which incoming ZDO request messages are passed to the application.

value.name: EMBER_APP_RECEIVES_SUPPORTED_ZDO_REQUESTS
value.description: Set this flag in order to receive supported ZDO request messages via the incomingMessageHandler callback. A supported ZDO request is one that is handled by the EmberZNet stack. The stack will continue to handle the request and send the appropriate ZDO response even if this configuration option is enabled.

value.name: EMBER_APP_HANDLES_UNSUPPORTED_ZDO_REQUESTS
value.description: Set this flag in order to receive unsupported ZDO request messages via the incomingMessageHandler callback. An unsupported ZDO request is one that is not handled by the EmberZNet stack, other than to send a 'not supported' ZDO response. If this configuration option is enabled, the stack will no longer send any ZDO response, and it is the application's responsibility to do so.

value.name: EMBER_APP_HANDLES_ZDO_ENDPOINT_REQUESTS
value.description: Set this flag in order to receive the following ZDO request messages via the incomingMessageHandler callback: SIMPLE_DESCRIPTOR_REQUEST, MATCH_DESCRIPTORS_REQUEST, and ACTIVE_ENDPOINTS_REQUEST. If this configuration option is enabled, the stack will no longer send any ZDO response for these requests, and it is the application's responsibility to do so.

value.name: EMBER_APP_HANDLES_ZDO_BINDING_REQUESTS
value.description: Set this flag in order to receive the following ZDO request messages via the incomingMessageHandler callback: BINDING_TABLE_REQUEST, BIND_REQUEST, and UNBIND_REQUEST. If this configuration option is enabled, the stack will no longer send any ZDO response for these requests, and it is the application's responsibility to do so.

value.name: EMBER_TX_POWER_MODE_DEFAULT
value.description: Normal power mode and bi-directional RF transmitter output.

value.name: EMBER_TX_POWER_MODE_BOOST
value.description: Enable boost power mode. This is a high performance radio mode which offers increased receive sensitivity and transmit power at the cost of an increase in power consumption.

value.name: EMBER_TX_POWER_MODE_ALTERNATE
value.description: Enable the alternate transmitter output. This allows for simplified connection to an external power amplifier via the RF_TX_ALT_P and RF_TX_ALT_N pins.

value.name: EMBER_TX_POWER_MODE_BOOST_AND_ALTERNATE
value.description: Enable both boost mode and the alternate transmitter output.

enum.name: EzspConfigId
enum.description: Identifies which configuration value to read or change with getConfigurationValue and setConfigurationValue.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_PACKET_BUFFER_COUNT
value.description: The number of packet buffers available to the stack. When set to the special value 0xFF, the NCP will allocate all remaining configuration RAM towards packet buffers, such that the resulting count will be the largest whole number of packet buffers that can fit into the available memory.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_NEIGHBOR_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of router neighbors the stack can keep track of. A neighbor is a node within radio range.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_APS_UNICAST_MESSAGE_COUNT
value.description: The maximum number of APS retried messages the stack can be transmitting at any time.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_BINDING_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of non-volatile bindings supported by the stack.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_ADDRESS_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of EUI64 to network address associations that the stack can maintain for the application. (Note, the total number of such address associations maintained by the NCP is the sum of the value of this setting and the value of ::EZSP_CONFIG_TRUST_CENTER_ADDRESS_CACHE_SIZE.).

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_MULTICAST_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of multicast groups that the device may be a member of.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_ROUTE_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of destinations to which a node can route messages. This includes both messages originating at this node and those relayed for others.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_DISCOVERY_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The number of simultaneous route discoveries that a node will support.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_STACK_PROFILE
value.description: Specifies the stack profile.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_SECURITY_LEVEL
value.description: The security level used for security at the MAC and network layers. The supported values are 0 (no security) and 5 (payload is encrypted and a four-byte MIC is used for authentication).

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_MAX_HOPS
value.description: The maximum number of hops for a message.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_MAX_END_DEVICE_CHILDREN
value.description: The maximum number of end device children that a router will support.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_INDIRECT_TRANSMISSION_TIMEOUT
value.description: The maximum amount of time that the MAC will hold a message for indirect transmission to a child.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_END_DEVICE_POLL_TIMEOUT
value.description: The maximum amount of time that an end device child can wait between polls. If no poll is heard within this timeout, then the parent removes the end device from its tables.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_MOBILE_NODE_POLL_TIMEOUT
value.description: The maximum amount of time that a mobile node can wait between polls. If no poll is heard within this timeout, then the parent removes the mobile node from its tables.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_RESERVED_MOBILE_CHILD_ENTRIES
value.description: The number of child table entries reserved for use only by mobile nodes.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_TX_POWER_MODE
value.description: Enables boost power mode and/or the alternate transmitter output.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_DISABLE_RELAY
value.description: 0: Allow this node to relay messages. 1: Prevent this node from relaying messages.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_TRUST_CENTER_ADDRESS_CACHE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of EUI64 to network address associations that the Trust Center can maintain. These address cache entries are reserved for and reused by the Trust Center when processing device join/rejoin authentications. This cache size limits the number of overlapping joins the Trust Center can process within a narrow time window (e.g. two seconds), and thus should be set to the maximum number of near simultaneous joins the Trust Center is expected to accommodate. (Note, the total number of such address associations maintained by the NCP is the sum of the value of this setting and the value of ::EZSP_CONFIG_ADDRESS_TABLE_SIZE.)

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_SOURCE_ROUTE_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The size of the source route table.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_END_DEVICE_POLL_TIMEOUT_SHIFT
value.description: The units used for timing out end devices on their parents.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_FRAGMENT_WINDOW_SIZE
value.description: The number of blocks of a fragmented message that can be sent in a single window.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_FRAGMENT_DELAY_MS
value.description: The time the stack will wait (in milliseconds) between sending blocks of a fragmented message.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_KEY_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The size of the Key Table used for storing individual link keys (if the device is a Trust Center) or Application Link Keys (if the device is a normal node).

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_APS_ACK_TIMEOUT
value.description: The APS ACK timeout value. The stack waits this amount of time between resends of APS retried messages.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_BEACON_JITTER_DURATION
value.description: The duration of a beacon jitter, in the units used by the 15.4 scan parameter (((1 less than duration) + 1) * 15ms), when responding to a beacon request.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_END_DEVICE_BIND_TIMEOUT
value.description: The time the coordinator will wait (in seconds) for a second end device bind request to arrive.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_PAN_ID_CONFLICT_REPORT_THRESHOLD
value.description: The number of PAN id conflict reports that must be received by the network manager within one minute to trigger a PAN id change.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_REQUEST_KEY_TIMEOUT
value.description: The timeout value in minutes for how long the Trust Center or a normal node waits for the ZigBee Request Key to complete. On the Trust Center this controls whether or not the device buffers the request, waiting for a matching pair of ZigBee Request Key. If the value is non-zero, the Trust Center buffers and waits for that amount of time. If the value is zero, the Trust Center does not buffer the request and immediately responds to the request. Zero is the most compliant behavior.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_CERTIFICATE_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: This value indicates the size of the runtime modifiable certificate table. Normally certificates are stored in MFG tokens but this table can be used to field upgrade devices with new Smart Energy certificates. This value cannot be set, it can only be queried.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_APPLICATION_ZDO_FLAGS
value.description: This is a bitmask that controls which incoming ZDO request messages are passed to the application. The bits are defined in the EmberZdoConfigurationFlags enumeration. To see if the application is required to send a ZDO response in reply to an incoming message, the application must check the APS options bitfield within the incomingMessageHandler callback to see if the EMBER_APS_OPTION_ZDO_RESPONSE_REQUIRED flag is set.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_BROADCAST_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The maximum number of broadcasts during a single broadcast timeout period.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_MAC_FILTER_TABLE_SIZE
value.description: The size of the MAC filter list table.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_SUPPORTED_NETWORKS
value.description: The number of supported networks.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_SEND_MULTICASTS_TO_SLEEPY_ADDRESS
value.description: Whether multicasts are sent to the RxOnWhenIdle=true address (0xFFFD) or the sleepy broadcast address (0xFFFF). The RxOnWhenIdle=true address is the ZigBee compliant destination for multicasts.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_ZLL_GROUP_ADDRESSES
value.description: ZLL group address initial configuration.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_ZLL_RSSI_THRESHOLD
value.description: ZLL rssi threshold initial configuration.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_MTORR_FLOW_CONTROL
value.description: Toggles the mtorr flow control in the stack.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_RETRY_QUEUE_SIZE
value.description: Setting the retry queue size.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_NEW_BROADCAST_ENTRY_THRESHOLD
value.description: Setting the new broadcast entry threshold.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_TRANSIENT_KEY_TIMEOUT_S
value.description: The length of time, in seconds, that a trust center will store a transient link key that a device can use to join its network. A transient key is added with a call to emberAddTransientLinkKey. After the transient key is added, it will be removed once this amount of time has passed. A joining device will not be able to use that key to join until it is added again on the trust center. The default value is 300 seconds, i.e., 5 minutes.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_BROADCAST_MIN_ACKS_NEEDED
value.description: The number of passive acknowledgements to record from neighbors before we stop re-transmitting broadcasts.

value.name: EZSP_CONFIG_TC_REJOINS_USING_WELL_KNOWN_KEY_TIMEOUT_S
value.description: The length of time, in seconds, that a trust center will allow a Trust Center (insecure) rejoin for a device that is using the well-known link key. This timeout takes effect once rejoins using the well-known key has been allowed. This command updates the emAllowTcRejoinsUsingWellKnownKeyTimeoutSec value.

value.name: EMBER_SUCCESS
value.description: The generic 'no error' message.

value.name: EMBER_ERR_FATAL
value.description: The generic 'fatal error' message.

value.name: EMBER_BAD_ARGUMENT
value.description: An invalid value was passed as an argument to a function

value.name: EMBER_EEPROM_MFG_STACK_VERSION_MISMATCH
value.description: The manufacturing and stack token format in nonvolatile memory is different than what the stack expects (returned at initialization).

value.name: EMBER_INCOMPATIBLE_STATIC_MEMORY_DEFINITIONS
value.description: The static memory definitions in ember-staticmemory.h are incompatible with this stack version

value.name: EMBER_EEPROM_MFG_VERSION_MISMATCH
value.description: The manufacturing token format in non-volatile memory is different than what the stack expects (returned at initialization).

value.name: EMBER_EEPROM_STACK_VERSION_MISMATCH
value.description: The stack token format in non-volatile memory is different than what the stack expects (returned at initialization).

value.name: EMBER_NO_BUFFERS
value.description: There are no more buffers.

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_INVALID_BAUD_RATE
value.description: Specified an invalid baud rate

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_INVALID_PORT
value.description: Specified an invalid baud rate

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_TX_OVERFLOW
value.description: Tried to send too much data

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_RX_OVERFLOW
value.description: There was not enough space to store a received character and the character was dropped.

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_RX_FRAME_ERROR
value.description: Detected a UART framing error

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_RX_PARITY_ERROR
value.description: Detected a UART parity error.

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_RX_EMPTY
value.description: There is no received data to process.

value.name: EMBER_SERIAL_RX_OVERRUN_ERROR
value.description: The receive interrupt was not handled in time, and a character was dropped.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_TRANSMIT_QUEUE_FULL
value.description: The MAC transmit queue is full

value.name: EMBER_MAC_UNKNOWN_HEADER_TYPE
value.description: MAC header FCR error on receive

value.name: EMBER_MAC_SCANNING
value.description: The MAC can't complete this task because it is scanning.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_NO_DATA
value.description: No pending data exists for device doing a data poll.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_JOINED_NETWORK
value.description: Attempt to scan when we are joined to a network.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_BAD_SCAN_DURATION
value.description: Scan duration must be 0 to 14 inclusive. Attempt was made to scan with an incorrect duration value.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_INCORRECT_SCAN_TYPE
value.description: emberStartScan was called with an incorrect scan type.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_INVALID_CHANNEL_MASK
value.description: emberStartScan was called with an invalid channel mask.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_COMMAND_TRANSMIT_FAILURE
value.description: Failed to scan current channel because we were unable to transmit the relevant MAC command.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_NO_ACK_RECEIVED
value.description: We expected to receive an ACK following the transmission, but the MAC level ACK was never received.

value.name: EMBER_MAC_INDIRECT_TIMEOUT
value.description: Indirect data message timed out before polled.

value.name: EMBER_SIM_EEPROM_ERASE_PAGE_GREEN
value.description: The Simulated EEPROM is telling the application that there is at least one flash page to be erased. The GREEN status means the current page has not filled above the ERASE_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD. The application should call the function halSimEepromErasePage when it can to erase a page.

value.name: EMBER_SIM_EEPROM_ERASE_PAGE_RED
value.description: The Simulated EEPROM is telling the application that there is at least one flash page to be erased. The RED status means the current page has filled above the ERASE_CRITICAL_THRESHOLD. Due to the shrinking availability of write space, there is a danger of data loss. The application must call the function halSimEepromErasePage as soon as possible to erase a page.

value.name: EMBER_SIM_EEPROM_FULL
value.description: The Simulated EEPROM has run out of room to write any new data and the data trying to be set has been lost. This error code is the result of ignoring the SIM_EEPROM_ERASE_PAGE_RED error code. The application must call the function halSimEepromErasePage to make room for any further calls to set a token.

value.name: EMBER_ERR_FLASH_WRITE_INHIBITED
value.description: A fatal error has occurred while trying to write data to the Flash. The target memory attempting to be programmed is already programmed. The flash write routines were asked to flip a bit from a 0 to 1, which is physically impossible and the write was therefore inhibited. The data in the flash cannot be trusted after this error.

value.name: EMBER_ERR_FLASH_VERIFY_FAILED
value.description: A fatal error has occurred while trying to write data to the Flash and the write verification has failed. The data in the flash cannot be trusted after this error, and it is possible this error is the result of exceeding the life cycles of the flash.

value.name: EMBER_SIM_EEPROM_INIT_1_FAILED
value.description: Attempt 1 to initialize the Simulated EEPROM has failed. This failure means the information already stored in Flash (or a lack thereof), is fatally incompatible with the token information compiled into the code image being run.

value.name: EMBER_SIM_EEPROM_INIT_2_FAILED
value.description: Attempt 2 to initialize the Simulated EEPROM has failed. This failure means Attempt 1 failed, and the token system failed to properly reload default tokens and reset the Simulated EEPROM.

value.name: EMBER_SIM_EEPROM_INIT_3_FAILED
value.description: Attempt 3 to initialize the Simulated EEPROM has failed. This failure means one or both of the tokens TOKEN_MFG_NVDATA_VERSION or TOKEN_STACK_NVDATA_VERSION were incorrect and the token system failed to properly reload default tokens and reset the Simulated EEPROM.

value.name: EMBER_ERR_FLASH_PROG_FAIL
value.description: A fatal error has occurred while trying to write data to the flash, possibly due to write protection or an invalid address. The data in the flash cannot be trusted after this error, and it is possible this error is the result of exceeding the life cycles of the flash.

value.name: EMBER_ERR_FLASH_ERASE_FAIL
value.description: A fatal error has occurred while trying to erase flash, possibly due to write protection. The data in the flash cannot be trusted after this error, and it is possible this error is the result of exceeding the life cycles of the flash

value.name: EMBER_ERR_BOOTLOADER_TRAP_TABLE_BAD
value.description: The bootloader received an invalid message (failed attempt to go into bootloader).

value.name: EMBER_ERR_BOOTLOADER_TRAP_UNKNOWN
value.description: Bootloader received an invalid message (failed attempt to go into bootloader).

value.name: EMBER_ERR_BOOTLOADER_NO_IMAGE
value.description: The bootloader cannot complete the bootload operation because either an image was not found or the image exceeded memory bounds.

value.name: EMBER_DELIVERY_FAILED
value.description: The APS layer attempted to send or deliver a message, but it failed.

value.name: EMBER_BINDING_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
value.description: This binding index is out of range of the current binding table.

value.name: EMBER_ADDRESS_TABLE_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
value.description: This address table index is out of range for the current address table.

value.name: EMBER_INVALID_BINDING_INDEX
value.description: An invalid binding table index was given to a function.

value.name: EMBER_INVALID_CALL
value.description: The API call is not allowed given the current state of the stack

value.name: EMBER_COST_NOT_KNOWN
value.description: The link cost to a node is not known.

value.name: EMBER_MAX_MESSAGE_LIMIT_REACHED
value.description: The maximum number of in-flight messages (i.e. EMBER_APS_UNICAST_MESSAGE_COUNT) has been reached.

value.name: EMBER_MESSAGE_TOO_LONG
value.description: The message to be transmitted is too big to fit into a single over-the-air packet

value.name: EMBER_BINDING_IS_ACTIVE
value.description: The application is trying to delete or overwrite a binding that is in use.

value.name: EMBER_ADDRESS_TABLE_ENTRY_IS_ACTIVE
value.description: The application is trying to overwrite an address table entry that is in use.

value.name: EMBER_ADC_CONVERSION_DONE
value.description: Conversion is complete.

value.name: EMBER_ADC_CONVERSION_BUSY
value.description: Conversion cannot be done because a request is being processed.

value.name: EMBER_ADC_CONVERSION_DEFERRED
value.description: Conversion is deferred until the current request has been processed.

value.name: EMBER_ADC_NO_CONVERSION_PENDING
value.description: No results are pending

value.name: EMBER_SLEEP_INTERRUPTED
value.description: Sleeping (for a duration) has been abnormally interrupted and exited prematurely.

value.name: EMBER_PHY_TX_UNDERFLOW
value.description: The transmit hardware buffer underflowed.

value.name: EMBER_PHY_TX_INCOMPLETE
value.description: The transmit hardware did not finish transmitting a packet.

value.name: EMBER_PHY_INVALID_CHANNEL
value.description: An unsupported channel setting was specified.

value.name: EMBER_PHY_INVALID_POWER
value.description: An unsupported power setting was specified.

value.name: EMBER_PHY_TX_BUSY
value.description: The packet cannot be transmitted because the physical MAC layer is currently transmitting a packet. (This is used for the MAC backoff algorithm.)

value.name: EMBER_PHY_TX_CCA_FAIL
value.description: The transmit attempt failed because all CCA attempts indicated that the channel was busy

value.name: EMBER_PHY_OSCILLATOR_CHECK_FAILED
value.description: The software installed on the hardware doesn't recognize the hardware radio type.

value.name: EMBER_PHY_ACK_RECEIVED
value.description: The expected ACK was received after the last transmission.

value.name: EMBER_NETWORK_UP
value.description: The stack software has completed initialization and is ready to send and receive packets over the air

value.name: EMBER_NETWORK_DOWN
value.description: The network is not operating.

value.name: EMBER_JOIN_FAILED
value.description: An attempt to join a network failed.

value.name: EMBER_MOVE_FAILED
value.description: After moving, a mobile node's attempt to re-establish contact with the network failed.

value.name: EMBER_CANNOT_JOIN_AS_ROUTER
value.description: An attempt to join as a router failed due to a ZigBee versus ZigBee Pro incompatibility. ZigBee devices joining ZigBee Pro networks (or vice versa) must join as End Devices, not Routers.

value.name: EMBER_NODE_ID_CHANGED
value.description: The local node ID has changed. The application can obtain the new node ID by calling emberGetNodeId().

value.name: EMBER_PAN_ID_CHANGED
value.description: The local PAN ID has changed. The application can obtain the new PAN ID by calling emberGetPanId().

value.name: EMBER_NO_BEACONS
value.description: An attempt to join or rejoin the network failed because no router beacons could be heard by the joining node.

value.name: EMBER_RECEIVED_KEY_IN_THE_CLEAR
value.description: An attempt was made to join a Secured Network using a pre-configured key, but the Trust Center sent back a Network Key in-the-clear when an encrypted Network Key was required.

value.name: EMBER_NO_NETWORK_KEY_RECEIVED
value.description: An attempt was made to join a Secured Network, but the device did not receive a Network Key.

value.name: EMBER_NO_LINK_KEY_RECEIVED
value.description: After a device joined a Secured Network, a Link Key was requested but no response was ever received.

value.name: EMBER_PRECONFIGURED_KEY_REQUIRED
value.description: An attempt was made to join a Secured Network without a pre-configured key, but the Trust Center sent encrypted data using a pre-configured key.

value.name: EMBER_NOT_JOINED
value.description: The node has not joined a network.

value.name: EMBER_INVALID_SECURITY_LEVEL
value.description: The chosen security level (the value of EMBER_SECURITY_LEVEL) is not supported by the stack

value.name: EMBER_NETWORK_BUSY
value.description: A message cannot be sent because the network is currently overloaded.

value.name: EMBER_INVALID_ENDPOINT
value.description: The application tried to send a message using an endpoint that it has not defined.

value.name: EMBER_BINDING_HAS_CHANGED
value.description: The application tried to use a binding that has been remotely modified and the change has not yet been reported to the application.

value.name: EMBER_INSUFFICIENT_RANDOM_DATA
value.description: An attempt to generate random bytes failed because of insufficient random data from the radio.

value.name: EMBER_APS_ENCRYPTION_ERROR
value.description: There was an error in trying to encrypt at the APS Level. This could result from either an inability to determine the long address of the recipient from the short address (no entry in the binding table) or there is no link key entry in the table associated with the destination, or there was a failure to load the correct key into the encryption core.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_MASTER_KEY_NOT_SET
value.description: There was an attempt to form a network using commercial security without setting the Trust Center master key first.

value.name: EMBER_SECURITY_STATE_NOT_SET
value.description: There was an attempt to form or join a network with security without calling emberSetInitialSecurityState() first

value.name: EMBER_KEY_INVALID
value.description: The passed key data is not valid. A key of all zeros or all F's are reserved values and cannot be used.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_TABLE_INVALID_ADDRESS
value.description: There was an attempt to set an entry in the key table using an invalid long address. An entry cannot be set using either the local device's or Trust Center's IEEE address. Or an entry already exists in the table with the same IEEE address. An Address of all zeros or all F's are not valid addresses in 802.15.4.

value.name: EMBER_SECURITY_CONFIGURATION_INVALID
value.description: There was an attempt to set a security configuration that is not valid given the other security settings.

value.name: EMBER_TOO_SOON_FOR_SWITCH_KEY
value.description: There was an attempt to broadcast a key switch too quickly after broadcasting the next network key. The Trust Center must wait at least a period equal to the broadcast timeout so that all routers have a chance to receive the broadcast of the new network key.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_NOT_AUTHORIZED
value.description: The message could not be sent because the link key corresponding to the destination is not authorized for use in APS data messages. APS Commands (sent by the stack) are allowed. To use it for encryption of APS data messages it must be authorized using a key agreement protocol (such as CBKE).

value.name: EMBER_SECURITY_DATA_INVALID
value.description: The security data provided was not valid, or an integrity check failed.

value.name: EMBER_SOURCE_ROUTE_FAILURE
value.description: A ZigBee route error command frame was received indicating that a source routed message from this node failed en route.

value.name: EMBER_MANY_TO_ONE_ROUTE_FAILURE
value.description: A ZigBee route error command frame was received indicating that a message sent to this node along a many-to-one route failed en route. The route error frame was delivered by an ad-hoc search for a functioning route.

value.name: EMBER_STACK_AND_HARDWARE_MISMATCH
value.description: A critical and fatal error indicating that the version of the stack trying to run does not match with the chip it is running on. The software (stack) on the chip must be replaced with software that is compatible with the chip

value.name: EMBER_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
value.description: An index was passed into the function that was larger than the valid range.

value.name: EMBER_TABLE_FULL
value.description: There are no empty entries left in the table.

value.name: EMBER_TABLE_ENTRY_ERASED
value.description: The requested table entry has been erased and contains no valid data.

value.name: EMBER_LIBRARY_NOT_PRESENT
value.description: The requested function cannot be executed because the library that contains the necessary functionality is not present.

value.name: EMBER_OPERATION_IN_PROGRESS
value.description: The stack accepted the command and is currently processing the request. The results will be returned via an appropriate handler.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_0
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_1
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_2
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_3
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_4
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_5
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_6
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_7
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_8
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_9
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_10
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_11
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_12
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_13
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_14
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_ERROR_15
value.description: This error is reserved for customer application use. This will never be returned from any portion of the network stack or HAL.

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_UNICAST
value.description: Unicast

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_UNICAST_REPLY
value.description: Unicast reply

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_MULTICAST
value.description: Multicast

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_MULTICAST_LOOPBACK
value.description: Multicast sent by the local device

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_BROADCAST
value.description: Broadcast

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_BROADCAST_LOOPBACK
value.description: Broadcast sent by the local device.

value.name: EMBER_INCOMING_MANY_TO_ONE_ROUTE_REQUEST
value.description: Many to one route request

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_NONE
value.description: No options

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ENCRYPTION
value.description: Send the message using APS Encryption, using the Link Key shared with the destination node to encrypt the data at the APS Level.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_RETRY
value.description: Resend the message using the APS retry mechanism.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ENABLE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY
value.description: Causes a route discovery to be initiated if no route to the destination is known.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_FORCE_ROUTE_DISCOVERY
value.description: Causes a route discovery to be initiated even if one is known.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_SOURCE_EUI64
value.description: Include the source EUI64 in the network frame.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_DESTINATION_EUI64
value.description: Include the destination EUI64 in the network frame

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ENABLE_ADDRESS_DISCOVERY
value.description: Send a ZDO request to discover the node ID of the destination, if it is not already know.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_POLL_RESPONSE
value.description: Reserved

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_ZDO_RESPONSE_REQUIRED
value.description: This incoming message is a ZDO request not handled by the EmberZNet stack, and the application is responsible for sending a ZDO response. This flag is used only when the ZDO is configured to have requests handled by the application. See the EZSP_CONFIG_APPLICATION_ZDO_FLAGS configuration parameter for more information.

value.name: EMBER_APS_OPTION_FRAGMENT
value.description: This message is part of a fragmented message. This option may only be set for unicasts. The groupId field gives the index of this fragment in the low-order byte. If the low-order byte is zero this is the first fragment and the high-order byte contains the number of fragments in the message.

value.name: EMBER_USE_PRECONFIGURED_KEY
value.description: Allow the node to join. The joining node should have a pre-configured key. The security data sent to it will be encrypted with that key.

value.name: EMBER_SEND_KEY_IN_THE_CLEAR
value.description: Allow the node to join. Send the necessary key (the Network Key in Standard Security mode, the Trust Center Master in High Security mode) in-the-clear to the joining device.

value.name: EMBER_DENY_JOIN
value.description: Deny join.

value.name: EMBER_NO_ACTION
value.description: Take no action.

value.name: EMBER_UNKNOWN_DEVICE
value.description: Device is not joined

value.name: EMBER_COORDINATOR
value.description: Will relay messages and can act as a parent to other nodes.

value.name: EMBER_ROUTER
value.description: Will relay messages and can act as a parent to other nodes.

value.name: EMBER_END_DEVICE
value.description: Communicates only with its parent and will not relay messages.

value.name: EMBER_SLEEPY_END_DEVICE
value.description: An end device whose radio can be turned off to save power. The application must poll to receive messages.

value.name: EMBER_MOBILE_END_DEVICE
value.description: A sleepy end device that can move through the network.

value.name: EMBER_RF4CE_TARGET
value.description: RF4CE target node.

value.name: EMBER_RF4CE_CONTROLLER
value.description: RF4CE controller node.

value.name: EZSP_ENERGY_SCAN
value.description: An energy scan scans each channel for its RSSI value.

value.name: EZSP_ACTIVE_SCAN
value.description: An active scan scans each channel for available networks.

value.name: EMBER_STANDARD_SECURITY_MODE
value.description: This enables ZigBee Standard Security on the node.

value.name: EMBER_DISTRIBUTED_TRUST_CENTER_MODE
value.description: This enables Distributed Trust Center Mode for the device forming the network. (Previously known as EMBER_NO_TRUST_CENTER_MODE)

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_GLOBAL_LINK_KEY
value.description: This enables a Global Link Key for the Trust Center. All nodes will share the same Trust Center Link Key

value.name: EMBER_PRECONFIGURED_NETWORK_KEY_MODE
value.description: This enables devices that perform MAC Association with a pre-configured Network Key to join the network. It is only set on the Trust Center.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_TRUST_CENTER_EUI64
value.description: This denotes that the ::EmberInitialSecurityState::preconfiguredTrustCenterEui64 has a value in it containing the trust center EUI64. The device will only join a network and accept commands from a trust center with that EUI64. Normally this bit is NOT set, and the EUI64 of the trust center is learned during the join process. When commissioning a device to join onto an existing network that is using a trust center, and without sending any messages, this bit must be set and the field ::EmberInitialSecurityState::preconfiguredTrustCenterEui64 must be populated with the appropriate EUI64.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_USES_HASHED_LINK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the preconfiguredKey is not the actual Link Key but a Secret Key known only to the Trust Center. It is hashed with the IEEE Address of the destination device in order to create the actual Link Key used in encryption. This is bit is only used by the Trust Center. The joining device need not set this.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_PRECONFIGURED_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the preconfiguredKey element has valid data that should be used to configure the initial security state.

value.name: EMBER_HAVE_NETWORK_KEY
value.description: This denotes that the networkKey element has valid data that should be used to configure the initial security state.

value.name: EMBER_GET_LINK_KEY_WHEN_JOINING
value.description: This denotes to a joining node that it should attempt to acquire a Trust Center Link Key during joining. This is only necessary if the device does not have a pre-configured key.

value.name: EMBER_REQUIRE_ENCRYPTED_KEY
value.description: This denotes that a joining device should only accept an encrypted network key from the Trust Center (using its preconfigured key). A key sent in-the-clear by the Trust Center will be rejected and the join will fail. This option is only valid when utilizing a pre-configured key.

value.name: EMBER_NO_FRAME_COUNTER_RESET
value.description: This denotes whether the device should NOT reset its outgoing frame counters (both NWK and APS) when ::emberSetInitialSecurityState() is called. Normally it is advised to reset the frame counter before joining a new network. However in cases where a device is joining to the same network a again (but not using ::emberRejoinNetwork()) it should keep the NWK and APS frame counters stored in its tokens.

value.name: EMBER_GET_PRECONFIGURED_KEY_FROM_INSTALL_CODE
value.description: This denotes that the device should obtain its preconfigured key from an installation code stored in the manufacturing token. The token contains a value that will be hashed to obtain the actual preconfigured key. If that token is not valid, then the call to emberSetInitialSecurityState() will fail.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_LINK_KEY
value.description: A shared key between the Trust Center and a device.

value.name: EMBER_TRUST_CENTER_MASTER_KEY
value.description: A shared secret used for deriving keys between the Trust Center and a device

value.name: EMBER_CURRENT_NETWORK_KEY
value.description: The current active Network Key used by all devices in the network.

value.name: EMBER_NEXT_NETWORK_KEY
value.description: The alternate Network Key that was previously in use, or the newer key that will be switched to.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_LINK_KEY
value.description: An Application Link Key shared with another (non-Trust Center) device.

value.name: EMBER_APPLICATION_MASTER_KEY
value.description: An Application Master Key shared secret used to derive an Application Link Key.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
value.description: The key has a sequence number associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_OUTGOING_FRAME_COUNTER
value.description: The key has an outgoing frame counter associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_INCOMING_FRAME_COUNTER
value.description: The key has an incoming frame counter associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_HAS_PARTNER_EUI64
value.description: The key has a Partner IEEE address associated with it.

value.name: EMBER_KEY_IS_AUTHORIZED
value.description: This indicates the key is authorized for use in APS data messages. If the key is not authorized for use in APS data messages it has not yet gone through a key agreement protocol, such as CBKE (i.e. ECC).

value.name: EMBER_KEY_PARTNER_IS_SLEEPY
value.description: This indicates that the partner associated with the link is a sleepy end device. This bit is set automatically if the local device hears a device announce from the partner indicating it is not an 'RX on when idle' device.

value.name: EZSP_MFG_CUSTOM_VERSION
value.description: Custom version (2 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_STRING
value.description: Manufacturing string (16 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_BOARD_NAME
value.description: Board name (16 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_MANUF_ID
value.description: Manufacturing ID (2 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_PHY_CONFIG
value.description: Radio configuration (2 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_BOOTLOAD_AES_KEY
value.description: Bootload AES key (16 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_ASH_CONFIG
value.description: ASH configuration (40 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_EZSP_STORAGE
value.description: EZSP storage (8 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_STACK_CAL_DATA
value.description: Radio calibration data (64 bytes). 4 bytes are stored for each of the 16 channels. This token is not stored in the Flash Information Area. It is updated by the stack each time a calibration is performed.

value.name: EZSP_MFG_CBKE_DATA
value.description: Certificate Based Key Exchange (CBKE) data (92 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_INSTALLATION_CODE
value.description: Installation code (20 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_STACK_CAL_FILTER
value.description: Radio channel filter calibration data (1 byte). This token is not stored in the Flash Information Area. It is updated by the stack each time a calibration is performed.

value.name: EZSP_MFG_CUSTOM_EUI_64
value.description: Custom EUI64 MAC address (8 bytes)

value.name: EZSP_MFG_CTUNE
value.description: CTUNE value (2 byte)

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_RX_BROADCAST
value.description: The MAC received a broadcast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_BROADCAST
value.description: The MAC transmitted a broadcast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_RX_UNICAST
value.description: The MAC received a unicast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_UNICAST_SUCCESS
value.description: The MAC successfully transmitted a unicast.

value.description: The MAC retried a unicast

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_MAC_TX_UNICAST_FAILED
value.description: The MAC unsuccessfully transmitted a unicast.

value.description: The APS layer transmitted a data broadcast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_RX_UNICAST

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DATA_TX_UNICAST_SUCCESS
value.description: The APS layer successfully transmitted a data unicast.

value.description: The APS layer retried a data unicast.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ROUTE_DISCOVERY_INITIATED
value.description: The network layer successfully submitted a new route discovery to the MAC.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NEIGHBOR_ADDED
value.description: An entry was added to the neighbor table.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NEIGHBOR_REMOVED
value.description: An entry was removed from the neighbor table.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NEIGHBOR_STALE
value.description: A neighbor table entry became stale because it had not been heard from.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_JOIN_INDICATION
value.description: A node joined or rejoined to the network via this node.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_CHILD_REMOVED
value.description: An entry was removed from the child table.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ASH_OVERFLOW_ERROR
value.description: EZSP-UART only. An overflow error occurred in the UART

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ASH_FRAMING_ERROR
value.description: EZSP-UART only. A framing error occurred in the UART

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ASH_OVERRUN_ERROR
value.description: EZSP-UART only. An overrun error occurred in the UART

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NWK_FRAME_COUNTER_FAILURE
value.description: A message was dropped at the network layer because the NWK frame counter was not higher than the last message seen from that source.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_FRAME_COUNTER_FAILURE
value.description: A message was dropped at the APS layer because the APS frame counter was not higher than the last message seen from that source.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_UTILITY
value.description: Utility counter for general debugging use.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_LINK_KEY_NOT_AUTHORIZED
value.description: A message was dropped at the APS layer because it had APS encryption but the key associated with the sender has not been authenticated, and thus the key is not authorized for use in APS data messages.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_NWK_DECRYPTION_FAILURE
value.description: A NWK encrypted message was received but dropped because decryption failed.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_APS_DECRYPTION_FAILURE
value.description: An APS encrypted message was received but dropped because decryption failed.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_ALLOCATE_PACKET_BUFFER_FAILURE
value.description: The number of times we failed to allocate a set of linked packet buffers. This doesn't necessarily mean that the packet buffer count was 0 at the time, but that the number requested was greater than the number free.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_RELAYED_UNICAST
value.description: The number of relayed unicast packets.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_PHY_TO_MAC_QUEUE_LIMIT_REACHED
value.description: The number of times we dropped a packet due to reaching the preset PHY to MAC queue limit (emMaxPhyToMacQueueLength). The limit will determine how many messages are accepted by the PHY between calls to emberTick(). After that limit is hit, packets will be dropped. The number of dropped packets will be recorded in this counter. NOTE: For each call to emberCounterHandler() there may be more than 1 packet that was dropped due to the limit reached. The actual number of packets dropped will be returned in the 'data' parameter passed to that function.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_PACKET_VALIDATE_LIBRARY_DROPPED_COUNT
value.description: The number of times we dropped a packet due to the packet-validate library checking a packet and rejecting it due to length or other formatting problems.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_TYPE_NWK_RETRY_OVERFLOW
value.description: The number of times the NWK retry queue is full and a new message failed to be added.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_PHY_CCA_FAIL_COUNT
value.description: The number of times the PHY layer was unable to transmit due to a failed CCA

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_BROADCAST_TABLE_FULL
value.description: The number of times a NWK broadcast was dropped because the the broadcast table was full.

value.name: EMBER_COUNTER_TYPE_COUNT
value.description: A placeholder giving the number of Ember counter types.

value.name: EMBER_LOW_RAM_CONCENTRATOR
value.description: A concentrator with insufficient memory to store source routes for the entire network. Route records are sent to the concentrator prior to every inbound APS unicast.

value.name: EMBER_HIGH_RAM_CONCENTRATOR
value.description: A concentrator with sufficient memory to store source routes for the entire network. Remote nodes stop sending route records once the concentrator has successfully received one.

value.name: EZSP_VALUE_VERSION_INFO
value.description: Retrieves the version information from the stack on the NCP.

value.name: EZSP_VALUE_NEXT_HOST_REJOIN_REASON
value.description: This will get/set the rejoin reason noted by the host for a subsequent call to emberFindAndRejoinNetwork(). After a call to emberFindAndRejoinNetwork() the host's rejoin reason will be set to EMBER_REJOIN_REASON_NONE. The NCP will store the rejoin reason used by the call to emberFindAndRejoinNetwork()

value.name: EZSP_VALUE_LAST_REJOIN_REASON
value.description: This is the reason that the last rejoin took place. This value may only be retrieved, not set. The rejoin may have been initiated by the stack (NCP) or the application (host). If a host initiated a rejoin the reason will be set by default to EMBER_REJOIN_DUE_TO_APP_EVENT_1. If the application wishes to denote its own rejoin reasons it can do so by calling ezspSetValue(EMBER_VALUE_HOST_REJOIN_REASON, EMBER_REJOIN_DUE_TO_APP_EVENT_X). X is a number corresponding to one of the app events defined. If the NCP initiated a rejoin it will record this value internally for retrieval by ezspGetValue(EZSP_VALUE_REAL_REJOIN_REASON).

value.name: EZSP_VALUE_NEXT_ZIGBEE_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
value.description: The next ZigBee sequence number.
